strIntroduction: Maricar is a go-kart rental service, where you can enjoy cosplay and driving if you have a driver’s license. You can wear the Mario, superman, Ironman etc Costumes and go anywhere you want driving Maricar on the public road. There is no doubt that you will stand out in such vivid, unique Super Star Go-karting. Put your costumes on, play your favorite love songs on loud speakers, and drive around your favorite part of town in Tokyo! The Real Life Super Star Go-karting is coming true! There are free options: GPS car navigation (if available), action camera, loud sound speakers (if available), helmet, mask, and glasses. If you drive with your friends or families, the wireless applications can also be rented for a fee. strTitle: 25% OFF Rent a "Maricar" Go Kart around Tokyo from Roppongi

strIntroduction: You are going to have many Japanese experiences in one place at a Japanese home in a day. JR Shin-Urayasu station where we meet is 16 min by Rapid train and 20 min by local train. We meet at Shin-Urayasu Station and walk to our house, which takes about 5 min on foot. Lets start your day by having Japanese tea ceremony. You will learn the proper manners of how to have Matcha, Japanese green tea, by our traditional style. For example, you will learn how to pick up chopsticks ! It has rules too. Of course, you can try making tea by yourself! While you enjoy your tea time, I'll play Koto, a Japanese harp for you as a background music. I hope you can enjoy the exotic music! For lunch, let's try cooking a Japanese dish, Okonomiyaki, Hiroshima-style together. Okonom-yaki is a thin and flat pancake cooked on a hot plate with bits of meat and chopped cabbages. It is very tasty and a unique dish that you can't have in your country. After lunch, you can try on kimono. For ladies we have real fancy Japanese silk kimono. You can try on girls' kimono for wedding, too. For men we have yukata, a cotton summer kimono. For kids we have some kimono too (girls only with limited size). I take you to Shin-Urayasu station after all experience had done. Let's have fun time with this Japanese experience package together !!
strTitle: 30% OFF Whole Package of Japanese Experiences at Home, Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a truly great coffee experience in Tokyo! Our cafe is located between Shibyua and Yokohama, near Motosumiyoshi Station on the Tokyu-Toyoko Line. In this activity, you can learn how to drip coffee in an authentic Japanese way. Once you've learned it, your future coffee experience will never be the same again. We promise that this is something you've never done before! We will meet directly at our cafe, or we can pick you up at Motosumiyoshi Station. Then, you can enjoy wonderful coffee experience for about 1hour 30mins with an expert teacher. Little groups of up to 4 people are best for this activity. Children are welcome too. In the end, you can take 100 grams of coffee beans home with you as a present. Enjoy your life with a cup of coffee!
strTitle: Learn how to drip the best coffee in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy winter delicacies and see the great winter panorama of Mt. Fuji with this wonderful tour program! Experience an all-you-can-eat strawberry picking and enjoy a winter barbecue containing scallop, turban shell, shrimp, etc for lunch! This tour departs from Shinjuku Washington Hotel and will take you to Mitohama to enjoy 50 minutes seafood barbecue lunch, which includes scallop, turban shell, shrimp, and other delicious ingredients! After lunch, you will cross along the Suruga Bay for 20 minutes to enjoy the great view of snow-capped Mt. Fuji! You will visit Yamamoto Shokuhin for shopping, where you can get souvenirs for you to take home. After that you will visit Nakaizu, where you can enjoy 30 minutes all-you-can-eat sweet and juicy strawberries picking! After that, you will visit Gotenba for Toki No Sumika Illumination “Tunnel of Light”, which was ranked as No. 1 most popular illumination spot in Shizuoka and No. 2 in Japan last year before returning to Shinjuku! Last but not least, join the lucky draw game while traveling on the bus to win some wonderful prizes! The itinerary of this tour is as follows: - Depart from Shinjuku Washington Hotel at 10:20 - Visit Mitohama and have seafood barbecue lunch for 50 minutes and cruise along the Suruga Bay for 20 minutes - Visit Yamamoto Shokuhin for shopping - Visit Nakaizu and enjoy 30 minutes all-you-can-eat strawberries picking - Visit Gotenba Toki No Sumika to see the illuminations for 60 minutes - Return to Shinjuku and tour ends at 19:30 This tour program is very famous among both the locals and the foreigners and reservation is difficult to make! Use our service to book with no hassles and enjoy your winter with this ultimate tour program! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Strawberries Picking & Mt. Fuji Cruising in Shizuoka!

strIntroduction: A Brand New Entertainment Show has come to Tokyo! This is the musical SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX, which is a new fusion of traditional Japanese culture and anime! There will be synchronization of Japanese dancing (Kabuki and Nihon Buyo) and street dance, Japanese traditional musical instruments playing rock, projection mapping on stage, interactive segments... Enjoy the spectacular battle scenes of Samurai and Ninja coordinated with exciting music and projection mapping! This show has everything and will leave you reeling! SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX starts comparatively late at night so you will have plenty of time to explore the city of Tokyo and even enjoy dinner before the curtain rises. • Show start time: 19:00 or 20:30 depending on the day There is one show per day, running for 70 minutes. Opening time depends on the day you watch the musical, please see the calendar. • Download the free SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX app for subtitles and more! http://sakura-meijiza-app.com/index-en.html No need to worry about the language barrier. If you download the app for SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX, you will be able to read the subtitles and song lyrics ( English or Traditional and Simplified Chinese characters or Korean ) on your smartphone in real time as the show proceeds! You can sync your phone with the show as it starts, and the app will show you the lyrics of the songs as the performers sing them on stage. In addition, the app will add special visual effects to increase the unique interactive experience of this show! You can also take photos with the special filters made just for the show! • Share your experience on SNS! Unlike any other show you will see, you're free to take pictures of this stunning musical and share them on SNS - Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and any social media you like!. Normally taking pictures of plays and musicals in Japan is strictly prohibited, so this is a rare chance to take as many photos as you want and show them off to those who missed the show! • Ticket Availability SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX can be booked up until to 18:00 on the day of performance. The current scheduled run is until March 31st, 2017 - please check the calendar
strTitle: New Stage Show SAKURA – JAPAN IN THE BOX at Meijiza

strIntroduction: We love Kyoto and we love the world of the Geisha. It is our pleasure to provide impressive and fun experience to the people through traditional Kyoto culture. At our studio you can transform into a Geisha, complete with real traditional wigs, kimonos, obis, shoes and accessories. And then you can have a studio portrait made, take your own photos and walk around on the great old streets that are just minutes from our front door. Our staffs extend a warm welcome to you. Let us turn you into a Japanese Geisha. Many foreign guests have visited us. We are an internationally experienced team! We are located Kyoto's legendary Gion district, the most famous home of the Geisha in all of Japan. This area is loaded with old places and things to do: restaurants, ryokan inns, tea houses and other settings. Our studio is full of classic Japanese atmosphere. The studio is in a traditional machiya townhouse. We even have a tsuboniwa interior garden, where you can take pictures of yourself as a Geisha (it is the only place in Kyoto that offers this special background setting). Come and enjoy our maiko experience in traditional 100-year-old machiya townhouse! *Please note that if you make a booking with a walking plan or the plans that contains outdoor activities, it might be changed to the basic plan in case of rain.(You will get a refund for the price difference.)
strTitle: 15% OFF Maiko Makeover in Kyoto Gion

strIntroduction: Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo is one of the largest wholesale seafood markets in the world and is the most popular tourist destination among foreign visitors to Japan. The market includes an inner area consisting of over 600 wholesalers and an outer area containing a mixture of retail and wholesale vendors, as well as various sushi restaurants. Because the fish market is exclusive to wholesalers, many Tokyo natives aren't familiar with the sushi restaurants in the area and guidebooks about Tsukiji often provide varying information. In this tour, your guide's intimate knowledge of the market will give you access to information and places that you can't discover from guidebooks. Your tour guide "Tsukiji King" is a professional, English-speaking guide who has been active in the mass media field for his extensive knowledge of the market. Having written many books about the the market and its many restaurants, as well as featured in media programs across Japan, your tour guide will introduce you to delicious culinary experiences in Tsukiji. The tour starts from 9:30 am at Tsukiji Fish Market.
strTitle: 10% OFF Private Tokyo Tsukiji Fish Market Tour & Enjoy Sushi

strIntroduction: Yu-Art offers you Japanese Cultural Experience at a residence in the one of the most attractive area in Tokyo, Kichijoji. After your reservation is completed, a map to "Yu-Art" from Kichijoji Station will be sent to you by e-mail. It takes 5-6 minutes from Kichijoji Station. Below is the outline of this activity: Wagashi making in a kitchen of a residence The instructor introduces Wagashi which you will make and explains the ingredients. Different Wagashi design will be prepared according to the season. For example, Sakura-shaped ones for February & March, Iris-shaped ones for April & May, etc. First, you look at a demonstration of Wagashi making by the instructor. Then you make your first Wagashi step by step together with the instructor. You use only everyday utensils like a spoon & a knife and your hands only. Then, when you make the second one, you can change its color if you like! Having a Matcha tea with the Wagashi you made in a tea room You move to a tea room which is equipped for tea ceremonies in the same residence. You can have your Wagashi with a cup of Matcha tea that the instructor prepared in a traditional way. It’s nice to take photos of your Wagashi with the Matcha in the traditional Japanese tea room. * Basically, this activity is for adult guests, not for kids.
strTitle: Try Wagashi (Japanese confectionery) making & Matcha, Tokyo

strIntroduction: You'll meet your professional tour guide bright and early at 1:00 am to reserve your limited spot to the renown Tuna Auction. After you will witness first hand the early morning brokers check deep inside the famous tuna using flashlights, as they assess the quality of the fish. Then you will watch as exorbitant prices are paid for the high-quality tuna during the Tuna Auction from 5:30 am and 6:00 am. It's a rare and exciting opportunity to experience the the Tuna Auction live. Following the Tuna Auction, the expert guide will give you a short market tour in a small, exclusive group. In the short market tour, you will learn more history about the Tsukiji fish market and explore the vegetable market and the outside of the inside market. If you are lucky, you can watch the vegetable auction! You will also enjoy browsing various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, and dried seafood in the outer market. If you are craving some of the freshest sushi available in the world, you can finish the morning with a sushi breakfast, at your request. Please let the guide know in advance if you would like to be taken to a recommended sushi restaurant. Please note, the breakfast fee is not included in the tour price. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Add-On: Extended tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market If you would like to have a full tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market after your Tuna Auction Tour, you can add-on an extended walking tour! You can do so by purchasing the Add-on option along with your Tuna Auction Tour. Between the end of Tuna Auction Tour (around 5:30 am) and Tsukiji Fish Market opening time (9:00 am), the following is an example itinerary: - Breakfast at a sushi restaurant in Tsukiji market: The guide will bring you to one of their recommended restaurants for a fresh seafood breakfast (1 hour) - Tour the Outer Market: Browse various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, nori (dried seaweed), and dried seafood (1 hour) - Namiyoke Inari Shrine: Visit the Shinto shrine that translates to "protection of waves" that is meant to protect the Tsukiji Market. Then enjoy a relaxing coffee break before starting the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour (1 hour) The duration of the Tuna auction and market add on tour is approximately 10 hours, from 1:00 am until 11:00 am. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Please note that if your booking is for more than 5 people, you might be split into groups to meet the safety guidelines set by the market authorities. The Tuna Auction Tour is regularly available Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, excluding holidays and market closed days. Our tour guide will ensure you have access into the exclusive Tuna Auction, but remember you'll be 1 of 120 other visitors in waiting room and 60 of you will attend each of the 2 bustling auctions!
strTitle: Tsukiji Tuna Auction Tour with a Guide during the night

strIntroduction: What comes to your mind when you think of Japan? Many people first think of the image of Mt. Fuji! Since it was registered as a World Heritage site, Mt. Fuji is becoming more and more popular among not only tourists but also the Japanese. Mt.Fuji is the biggest mountain in Japan at a height of 3776 meters. This guided one-day tour includes a stop at the Fuji Visitor Center, a trip up to Mt. Fuji's 5th station at an elevation of 2,300 meters, a cruise on pristine Lake Ashi, and a ride on the Mt. Komagatake Ropeway which boasts great views of the surrounding Hakone National Park. You will be speechless when you see Mt. Fuji with the beautiful lake. Come join this tour if you want an easy way to experience Mt. Fuji! Itinerary: 7:30 - 9:00 a.m. -Depart Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal. *Report at least 10 minutes prior to departure. -Fuji Visitor Center Find out current weather conditions, history, formation, and ecology of Mt. Fuji through exhibits and movies. The second floor observatory deck provides views of Mt. Fuji from up close. -Mt. Fuji 5th Station Climb 2,300 meters (7,546 ft) above sea level for breathtaking views of Mt. Fuji and the surrounding lakes on a clear day. Torii gates, shrines, and souvenir shops decorate this station known as the border between the heavens and the earth. -Lunch You can enjoy Japanese style meal if you buy the option with lunch. If you buy the option with no lunch, please bring your meal. -Lake Ashi cruise Go on a Hakone sightseeing cruise aboard a pirate ship modeled after medieval times. The crater filled lake was born from a powerful volcanic eruption nearly 3,000 years ago and provides postcard views of Mt. Fuji from various angles. -Mt. Komagatake Ropeway Catch sweeping views of Mt. Fuji, Lake Ashi, Izu Peninsula, Izu Islands, Hakone National Park, and more while climbing up and down the mountain on an aerial cableway. -Return to Tokyo Return to Tokyo by bus 6:30 - 8:30 p.m. -You may choose to return to either Shinjuku or Ginza in Tokyo. Q.Can we buy our Hakone free pass when we collect and pay for our tickets? A.You can buy Hakone free pass at the Odakyuu foreigners tourist center without reservation. Q. Will there be enough room for my luggage on the bus? A. Yes, carry on size and larger luggage (that you would normally have to check in on a flight) can be accommodated. Pick-up Points: **Please clarify your preferred pick-up point from the list of pick-up points at the time of booking. We will send you an email with your confirmed pick-up point. You may be denied access to the tour if you do not board at your confirmed pick-up point. Cerulean Tower Tokyu (07:40) Hyatt Regency(08:05) Conrad Tokyo (08:10) The Capitol Hotel Tokyu (08:00) Daiichi Hotel Tokyo (08:25) Tokyo Dome Hotel (08:20) Grand Pacific Le Daiba(08:10) Hotel Chizan—so Tokyo(08:00) Courtyard by Marriott Cinza(08:l5) Grand Hyatt Tokyo(08:25) Grand Palace(07:50) Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal(09:00) Hilton Tokyo(07:55) Park Hyatt Tokyo(07:50) Intercontinental Tokyo Bay(08:30) Imperial (Main Bldg.)(08:25) Shinjuku Station East Exit (Bus Stop of Hato Bus)(07:45) Nikko Tokyo(08: 15) Keio Plaza Hotel Main Building 3F Guest Relations Desk (08:05) Mandarin Oriental(07:50) Hotel Metropolitan Tokyo(07:40) Sheraton Miyako Hotel Tokyo(07:50) New Sanno(08:05) Okura (Main Bldg)(08:10) New Otani (Main Bldg.)(07:50) Palace Hotel(08:05) Shinagawa Prince Main(08:05) Park Hotel Tokyo (1F)(08:20) Ritz Carlton Tokyo(08:15) Royal Park Shiodome Tower(08:25) Sunshine City Prince(07:30) Shiba Park Hotel(08:30) Grand Prince New Takanawa(08:20) Shinjuku Washington(07:55) ANA Inter Continental Tokyo(08:20) Tokyo Prince(08:30) Tokyo Sta.(Hato Bus Counter)(08:l5) The Prince Park Tower Tokyo(08:20) Westin Tokyo(07:55) For more Pick-up details, please check here. http://voyag.in/271VaVk ※Vegetarian meal Some animal products may be used as a soup stock for the vegetarian meal. Alcohol and mirin (sweet sake) can also be used for all types of meals. If you cannot eat these products, please choose the "without lunch" option.

strIntroduction: This is a 3-hour tour around the tea plantations in Shizuoka prefecture. 【Tea Plantation】 The host will guide you to the top of the mountain and tell you the history and production methods of the organic tea plantation founded in 1975. If the weather's nice, you can see great scenery such as Mt. Fuji, bay, peninsula and a bird's eye view of the city. 【Taste Tea】 Finally, there will be tea-tasting of green tea, black tea,etc. We will teach you how to make delicious tea too. Join me for a taste of Japanese tea, its culture, and the authentic lifestyle of the Japanese tea farmers! *Please note that due to seasonal harvesting we won't be able to host you everyday, so please contact us before you make any reservation. Do not hesitate to send us a message too if you have further questions with regards to the tour. Thank you for your kind understanding.
strTitle: Visit an Organic Tea Farm in Japan (3-hour tour)

strIntroduction: Hi, I'm Tamao! I will read your past, current and future from either palm reading, runestones, tarot cards or from angel cards. I will tell you the results based on Japanese and white magic at the end of the reading. White magic is a type of magic that brings you happiness and luck without any sacrifice or pain for anyone else. It is a very unselfish type of magic so please don't worry! If you have received unexpected fortune telling results in the past, or feel you are surrounded by bad luck, please don't worry. I will guide you through a journey that will bring luck and upgrade your fortune even if you are already lucky! I can give you detailed reading results as you present me with more detailed information about yourself. Please consult with me on what topics you would like to talk about, such as on your life, health, job and love life. I usually give my readings in Akebonobashi, 2 stops from Shinjuku, but if you wish I can go to your hotel in Tokyo to do the fortune telling. Please choose from either the 40 minutes or 80 minutes fortune telling plan and select your transportation option (if you wish me to go to your hotel) when you make the reservation.
strTitle: Experience Fortune Telling in Shinjuku

strIntroduction: Join our Osaka Afternoon Tour and discover Osaka's favorite snack - the Okonomiyaki or Takoyaki. You will have a private guide who will take you around Osaka! Go around the city in your preferred pace, and ask many questions! Osaka Castle, a grand structure dating back to the 17th century when Osaka became the center of Japan and began to prosper as a great town of merchants. First, we will visit “Dotonbori” to have a popular snack. It’s the liveliest area in the heart of the old town centre with lots of reasonably-priced restaurants and shops which have replaced the old theaters that used to thrive here. Osaka is called the town of “Kuidaore,” which translates to “eat until you drop.” Just like the locals, we will enjoy eating Okonomiyaki, a Japanese savory pancake containing a variety of ingredients such as cabbage, scallions and eggs, or Takoyaki, a savory round pancake with cooked octopus! Following our meal, we will take a casual stroll down Dotonbori Street and spot many peculiar shop signs along the way. Next we visit Osaka Castle. It boasts gigantic and exquisite stone walls which are the highest in all of Japan. Many sections of the castle have been lost in history. The total length of the stone walls is about 12km or 8miles. We will go around the Osaka Castle Park, up the five-story main tower and take a close look at the unbeatable walls surrounded by two large moats. This is the second Osaka Castle, built after the first Osaka Castle was burnt down during the Winter War and the Summer War in 1615. The stone walls of the first castle have been buried deep under the ground! There are many interesting stories about the castle, so let’s enjoy the sights and listened to the amazing history of the castle. Looking forward to meeting you and enjoying these two famous sights in Osaka! ※Osaka Castle will be closed from Dec/28/2016 to Jan/1/2017
strTitle: Private Osaka Castle Walking & Dotonbori Food Tour!

strIntroduction: ■What to Expect Experience the best views of Tokyo from inside a helicopter with large windows. Taking off from Tokyo Heliport, you fly over Rainbow Bridge, Odaiba, Hamarikyu Onshi-teien, Tokyo Tower, Tsukiji Market, The Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, The Sumida River, Ryogoku Kokugikan, Kaminari-mon, Tokyo Skytree, The Arakawa River, Kasai Rinkai Koen, and then back to Tokyo Heliport. The 600 meter panorama view is a new style of sightseeing. With tour narration there's no better way to enjoy the dramatic Tokyo skyline. Heliport fees are included. ■What's Included ・Sightseeing flight ・Flight insurance ・Gratuities ■Know Before You Go * The flight may be cancelled due to bad weather. * The flight course may be changed due to weather. * Tax and insurance are included in the price. * Possible reservation time: 10:00 – 16:00 * Please come to Tokyo Heliport at least 30 minutes before your reservation time. If you are late, you may not be able to board the helicopter. • If the tour can't be conducted due to inclement weather, specific problems with the aircraft, other disturbances to flight operations or flight cancellation, you may ask for a refund or change to an alternative date • You will be informed by the host if your flight is cancelled due to the above. For morning flights, you will be notified before 16:00 the day before; for evening flights, two hours before. In some cases, even if you have arrived at heliport, there remains a possibility that your flight will cancelled due to above reasons. We apologize sincerely in advance for this
strTitle: Tokyo sky cruising: Helicopter tour over Tokyo

strIntroduction: 【Learn Japanese with us and explore Japan with Japanese! 】 Hi, I'm Megumi! I got the Japanese teaching licence in 2009. I've been teaching for more than 5 years. I've taught students from different countries like the U.S, Hong Kong, Taiwan and Indonesia.I hope to teach you and learn from you as well. Learning Japanese isn't as hard as you think! I'll help you learn Japanese in an easy and fun way. After my 2 hours class, you will be able to introduce yourself, ask for directions, make orders at restaurants in Japanese. And if you need, you can get a short Kanji lecture. I can teach you how to write your name in Kanji as well.
strTitle: Take a Japanese Language Class for beginners in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Your guide book might say Kabukicho and Shinjuku Golden Gai are not safe areas, and usually Travel agencies don't do guides here. But these areas have a very special and unique atmosphere and it's a much safer place now than it once used to be. Let me introduce you to these two areas. -Kabukicho Kabukicho is the largest red-light district in Japan, without the official red-light prostitutes. But it has very different atmosphere compared to red-light districts in Europe. -Shinjuku Golden Gai Shinjuku Golden Gai is a bar area. The style of the bars is unique, not like the ones you will see in other places. Let's explore the busiest city, Shinjuku at night time. ●Tour days and time: Monday to Friday Starting time is 5:30 pm ●Meeting point: JR Shinjuku station, East exit, outside tickets gate, NEWDAYS SHOP, front of bouquet. If you are coming by walking, go to JR Shinjuku Station, East gate entrance. You will see Police box, KOBAN next to East gate entrance. Go down to the stairs in the entrance. Then you will see the NEWDAYS Shop. ●The duration of this tour 2 hours ●Cost: Included only guide fee. Drink and food are NOT included. Please pay for host's meals during the tour. If you have any questions or would like further information for my tours, please send a message.
strTitle: Kabukicho and Shinjuku Golden Gai Night Tour

strIntroduction: Rent go-karts and enjoy driving them on the public road starting off from Tokyo's iconic Otaku paradise, Akihabara! This kart rental shop in Akihabara is the first go-kart rental shop for driving on the public road. It is good to use as you go sightseeing because you can see Tokyo from different places. People rent karts for events, advertisements and for many other purposes. You can enjoy the go-karts privately or with a group and enjoy cosplay while driving. Many people wear the Mario costume and enjoy Mario Kart on the public road! There's no doubt that you will stand out in such vivid, unique kart! Why we love it: - You can drive on the public road without a seat belt or helmet. - If you feel uncomfortable about driving in a big city like Tokyo, you can book the optional English Driver Guide who will take you to some of the highlights in the area. - The kart's maximum speed is 60km/h! - You can go outside Akihabara if you return in time! - Some people drove all the way to Nagoya to establish a record. - People who are planning to purchase the kart, Youtubers who are filming videos, birthday presents for the kids, etc. - many kinds of people rent go-karts! You can rent a go-kart from 1 hour to up to 5 hours. Business hours: 10 am - 8 pm Note that the go-kart activity will not be available after 8 pm, therefore book earlier if you want to enjoy your entire requested time. For example, if you want to book a 2-hour tour, the latest possible time for booking will be 6 pm. After they give you a lecture, you can go for a drive! Please note that: ※ You must have a valid Japanese drivers license, Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit based on the 1949 Geneva Convention*. ※ Bring a valid Japanese drivers license, Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit* and a copy of your passport (passport is not required for Japanese) to the shop on the day. ※ All karts are for 1-person. There are no multi-person karts. ※ You have to fill the tank up before you return the kart when you choose the 2, 3, or 5 hour course. ※ We don't recommend you park the kart anywhere because there are not many parking lots in Tokyo, and we can't take any responsibility if any accidents happen to the kart. ※ The facility has costumes that you can borrow for no charge. However, you can buy some inexpensive costumes at the nearby Don Quixote shop if you would like your own! ※ You can book an optional add-on for a driver to guide you throughout Akihabara. The driver will drive in a separate kart. ※ The height restriction: must be 150cm to 185cm. ※ Preferred 100 kg and less. Over 100kg: the kart won’t move as fast ※ The activity is cancelled only when it rains heavily. When the activity is cancelled due to bad weather, you will be able to re-schedule without charge. If the alternative date for re-scheduling due to bad weather is not available, you will get a full refund. ※Pregnant Drivers: It is possible for pregnant drivers to take part in this experience but the go-kart handle may hit the guest's tummy and it may be uncomfortable. It is possible to make a booking first and go to shop try to see if she can fit comfortably in the kart. If the pregnant guest cannot fit, a refund will be provided for the pregnant guest. ※ You will need to buy "Flexible date/time change" option when you re-schedule the date for your own reasons. ※ The insurance fee is included in the price. Third Party Liability = Unlimited Guest himself/herself = up to JPY 30,000,000 Disclaimer = JPY 50,000 ※ In case of an accident caused intentionally or by negligence, the deductible amount can go up to 50 000 JPY. *Holders of a license from Belgium, France, Germany, Monaco, Slovenia, Switzerland or Taiwan can use an official Japanese translation provided by the Japan Automobile Federation (JAF) or the country’s embassy or consulate in Japan. strIntroduction: Explore the amazing Tsukiji Fish Market in an entertaining tour with an experienced professional guide! Don't miss this opportunity to visit the world's largest fish market before it gets moved to a different location. Below is the itinerary for this tour: 9:00 am: Meet at the subway exit of the nearest subway station (the exact location will be provided after you book) 9:00 - 9:30am: Fruits and vegetables section 9:30am-10:15 am: Fish market(Tsukiji inner market) 10:15-10:20am: Uogashi yokocho 10:20am-11:00am: Namiyoke shrine and Tsukiji outer market ※If you have a child in your group please let me know in advance. Important rules to observe while exploring the market: Tsukiji is a business market, so visitors should be very aware of their surroundings and be sure to step out of the way of workers on fast-moving turrets or in the narrow aisles of the inner market. - Do not obstruct traffic. - Do not bring large bags or suitcases into the market. - Do not enter the market in high heeled shoes or sandals. - Do not bring small children or pets. - Do not smoke in the market. - Do not touch any of the fish. The various types of fresh fish and other seafood from around the world, combined with the bustling atmosphere created by intermediate wholesalers and various vehicles whizzing around have given the market a unique ambiance. However, it has been scheduled to be relocated to Toyosu. Then visitors will no longer be able to walk among the colorful and dizzying seafood stalls. The new location will instead have a viewing area overlooking the wholesaler's area（nakaoroshi）so now is your best chance to see the market from a close distance! Tsukiji Fish Market is closed every Sunday and on the following days: Closed Dates in 2017: January 1,2,3,4,8,9,15,18,22,25,29 February 1,5,11,12,15,19,22,26 March 5,8,12,15,19,20,26,29 April 2,5,9,12,16,19,23,29,30 May 3,4,5,7,10,14,21,24,28 June 4,7,11,14,18,21,25,28 July 2,5,9,16,17,23,26,30 August 6,11,13,14,15,20,23,27,30 September 3,10,13,17,18,23,24,27
strTitle: 30% OFF Explore Tsukiji Fish Market in a fun local tour!

strIntroduction: Is it possible to make your own samurai sword? Of course, if you have about 10 years of time to spend! However, the basic Japanese style knife making course takes just one day. This is an activity where you can experience and learn the specifics of this traditional culture. After completing the work, you can take the Japanese-style knife you made home with you. You will use the same tools used for Japanese sword making when you forge the knife in the morning. Lunch will be eaten at the smithy, and then in the afternoon you will complete the activity by shaping the knife. Please enjoy our traditional culture through experiencing Japanese-style knife making. The following is an example schedule for this activity: 8:30 to 9:00 (Pick-up at Gifu-Hashima Station) 9:00 to 11:30 forging the knife at the atelier 11:30 to 13:00 lunch 13:00 to 15:00 shaping the knife at the atelier 15:00 to 16:00 completing the work 16:00 to 16:30 end of the activity (we'll take you back to Gifu-Hashima Station) We will prepare lunch here for you. Please let us know if you have food restrictions for health reasons, religion, etc. The number of lunch options purchased should be lower than the total number of participants, because lunch is included in the price of the knife making activity. Please book the lunch-only option only for those people who will not participate in the knife making activity. Transportation access: Ride the Shinkansen (bullet train) to Gifu-Hashima Station. The following is the approximate time it takes from Japan's major cities: Kyoto - 30 min Tokyo - 1 hour and 50 min Nagoya - 10 min Osaka - 50 min If you're coming by car get off at Meishin Highway Gifu-Hashima IC and drive for 3 minutes to the station.
strTitle: Make your own samurai knife with a certified swordsmith!

strIntroduction: We coordinate local volunteers to accompany you at the meal table to assist you with choosing your meal. We will translate menus, give you suggestions and introduce you to the real Japanese way of ordering food and drinks at a izakaya. We'll have some drinks and nice food, and enjoy a fun chat! Please let us know your preferable date/time and place! We will then connect you and local volunteers, and he/she will pick you up at your hotel or a famous landmark, and take you to the Izakaya.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Dishes with Locals at an Izakaya in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Come join us at our full-service Taiko studio! Taiko refers to a range of traditional Japanese drums, which are often played both for leisure and at festivals and celebrations. In this activity, you will experience: 1) Full line-up of Japanese drums, from O-Daiko, Nagadodaiko, Shimedaiko, and Okedodaiko that you are free to try. 2) Basic striking techniques, stance, and rhythms. 3) Learn traditional Japanese songs and show off your skills with a group performance at the end of the activity.
strTitle: Learn to Play Taiko

strIntroduction: Explore the Akihabara and Kanda districts and discover interesting new places in this tour. Please check the following example timetable. (the starting time can be decided by you, only the necessary time for each part of the tour is mentioned below) 00:00 Meet up at "Akihabara Electric Town Exit" of JR Akihabara station. 00:00~00:50 See the shrines, sacred halls and the famous spots around the area. Kanda Shrine is one of the most famous shrines in Tokyo. Its traditional events is the "Kanda festival" which is known as one of Tokyo's three biggest festivals. 00:50~01:10 Take a rest at traditional style cafe which has more than 150 years history. 01:10~01:50 Experience Akihabara's subcultures! Explore some of the popular "Maid cafes" and other places of fan-veneration such as toy stores or robot shops. If there will be any live show, we can try to watch it while drinking tea. 02:00 (apx.) At the end of tour, guide you to a shop, restaurant or a station of your choice. Part of the schedule might be changed depending on the day.
strTitle: Explore Akihabara and Kanda in a 2-hour tour with a local

strIntroduction: Our ancestors came to Tokyo over 400 years ago, following a feudal lord named Tokugawa Ieyasu, who founded the Tokugawa Shogunate in 1603. As the Shibatas had loyal ninjas, our ancestors could serve the government as heads of "Onmitsu" ninjas. If you check about your host's great grandfather, Shibata Takenaka, you can see our linage. As our ancestors worked for Tokugawa Shogunate for 265years, you can find some historical documents in libraries and the ministry of foreign affairs, which is rather unique, as most of ninja histories have been kept secret. In our clan we have crafted our weapons for over 400 years. You'll see some of the weapons hand-crafted by your host(ess) and her father. In your session, you will learn what our novices learn in his/her first class. The schedule is as follows: 1. Meditation 2. Change to a ninja outfit 3. Introduction to Ninja weapons 4. Practice Ninja Star techniques 5. Practice Boshuriken 6. Practice blowgun 7. Elective (Tell us what you want to learn - kunai, sword, introduction to shinagan waza, etc.) 8. Practice Kujikiri (well-wishing) technique 9. Photo time (Take photos with the ninjas) -Meditation The art of ninjutsu is more than learning the physical skills of the martial arts. It is also about finding your inner-self through physical conditioning, meditation, and discipline. With the practice of meditation, one develops key elements of increased awareness and detachment while increasing his/her sense of inner peace. It is through meditation that ninjas learn how to reach the "Ku" (no-self, void), and to control the energy called "Ki" which is the essential life force existing in all things in the universe. In meditation a ninja seeks to get to the "Ku no kyochi" (state of no-self) by integrating his/her body and mind. This state of mind gives a ninja the power to block out everything except the task at hand by using a sense of extreme calm and enhanced concentration. -Kujikiri Kujikiri is a series of nine symbolic hand gestures. It invokes the spiritual and mental strength. The hand signs are believed to be able to channel energy. The hand signs were taken from the practices of the early buddhists. They are used to build confidence and strength in the practitioner. They are also believed to enhance one’s senses of danger and enable one to foresee death. -Weapons See some of the famous weapons made by our master weaponsmith. -Elective Training Our training menu is made up based on the idea of Gorin (The Five Element Code, kunai, katana, taijutsu, etc.) Introducing Waza (skill) Shingan no sen Jitte http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kH_EjA0OuLI
strTitle: Be a Ninja: Learn Five Basic Techniques

strIntroduction: Our cozy Japanese tea house is located steps from the Yasaka shrine in the Gion area, one of Kyoto's most charming traditional neighbourhoods. Our goal is to provide a relaxing and calm environment for first-time visitors to enjoy a traditional tea ceremony and gain insight into traditional Japanese culture. Our 45-minute session starts with a brief introduction to tea and the history of the tea ceremony in Japan. Following this, we give provide a full demonstration of a formal tea ceremony, where you experience a real ceremony first hand. After our demonstration, we will explain the different steps we took and the significance of each step. You will then get to try making your own bowl of tea with a bamboo whisk! We will also serve you the customary snack to enjoy with your tea and show you how it should be eaten. Our experienced tea ceremony masters are fluent in English and would be happy to answer any of your questions during or after the session. Why we love it: -Tea ceremony is named "Kyoto's #7 Things to Do" by the Times Magazine -The traditional ritual is meant to show respect and nobility through slow and graceful movement and good etiquette. -Tea ceremony is held in a cozy tea house, located near Yasaka Shrine in Kyoto's charming Gion district. -1-hour session starts with a brief introduction of tea, followed by a full demonstration of this refined practice with detailed explanations. -Prepare your own tea with a bamboo stick whisk in a tatami tearoom. -Enjoy your tea with a classic Japanese sweet. Time Slots for regular demonstrations: - from 3 pm to 3:45 pm - from 4 pm to 4:45 pm - from 5 pm to 5:45 pm Private bookings available at: - 1 pm - 2 pm - 7 pm
strTitle: Enjoy an Authentic Tea Ceremony Experience in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Sumo is Japan's national sport! The Grand Tournament runs just 6 times a year, but the rest of the year there are many chances to see sumo wrestlers in action by watching them up-close-and-personal at a morning training session. Join our professional guides and be escorted to the sumo stable, learn about the history and how it's entwined with Japan's native Shinto religion, and see these impressive athletes at their rigorous training. Your guide will also be there to help you follow the rules and etiquettes of watching sumo in the stable. After the practice finishes, you'll have the exclusive opportunity to take photos with the sumo wrestlers! Training takes place in Tokyo, Osaka, and Nagoya according to the season. For Osaka, please see our other tour page here: http://voyag.in/sumo-morning-practice-osaka Please keep in mind the following precautions and rules when you visit the sumo stables: 1. A sumo stable is not a tourist facility. Sumo practice is very serious, so please show respect to the stable master and wrestlers. Failure to follow proper etiquette might result in being asked to leave the stable. 2. Please watch the practice quietly and do not move around in the stable. Children under 12 years of age are not permitted. Sumo fans are expected to be as still as possible during the practice. Depending on the tour date and sumo stable, well-behaved children under 12 years of age may be permitted to participate in the tour so please inquire with us before booking. 3. Please do not talk in the stable. Even your whispering voice may disturb the wrestlers. 4. Please do not stand on the ring or on the sandy ground. The ring is the sacred place for the wrestlers. 5. At the entrance of the stable, please take off your shoes before stepping onto the tatami floor. When you sit on the tatami floor, please cross your legs. Do not stretch your legs toward the ring as it is considered impolite to show the soles of feet to the wrestlers. 6. Please take off your hat and sunglasses inside the stable. 7. While inside the stable, you are not allowed to eat, drink, or smoke. 8. Cameras: If you ask for permission first, you will usually be permitted to take photos during the practice, but please never use a flash, loud shutter sounds, or take videos during the practice. If your camera makes a loud shutter sounds, you may be asked not to use it or switch to using another camera or a smartphone. In any case, please try to reduce the sound of the shutter in order not to disturb the morning practice. 9. Please turn off your mobile phone. 10. Once you start watching the practice, you are supposed to stay until the wrestlers finish their practice. So please try not to leave the stable during the practice. 11. Please don't bring a big backpack or luggage with you since the sumo stable has limited space for the audience. 12. If you have any visible tattoos, please cover them as much as possible. Tattoos are not widely accepted in Japanese society and particularly in traditional spaces such as the sumo stables. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For 2017 the preliminary schedule in Tokyo is as follows: January 3rd - 31st (except for January 22nd - 29th) February 1st - 22nd April 3rd - 30th May 1st - 27th June 5th - 21st August 1st - 31st September 1st - 23rd October 2nd - 25th December 4th - 29th (except for December 26th) Other dates are off-season for Sumo wrestlers with no official training sessions, so this tour will not be available. Instead, you can book tickets for the national Sumo tournaments held in the months when this tour is not available. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS ※ - The tour starting time can range between 7:30-9:30 am. - The sumo stable may be located in Tokyo, Kawasaki, Saitama, Chiba, or Ibaraki. The location is dependent on the sumo wrestlers' schedule. - The meeting point will be at the station nearest to the scheduled stable. The meeting time and meeting point depend on the sumo wrestlers' training schedule, which can only be confirmed when the date is close, since the wrestlers may change their training schedule according to their needs. - Children under the age of 12 and elderly people over the age of 60 will not be admitted inside the sumo stable as guests are required to sit still for most part of the practice session on the tatami floor. - The sumo stable has the right to refuse access to guests who are unable to observe the house manners, and anyone asked to leave the stable will not be able to re-enter - During busy periods this may be a large group tour (1-4 groups). - For large bookings, your group may be separated into 2 different stables. - It is very rare but in the case that the sumo wrestlers are unwell and other unforeseen circumstances, the practice and tour may be shortened. - There are no restrooms available at the sumo stable. - For the photo opportunity with the sumo wrestlers, you must stay for the entire duration of the practice. Photographs with the wrestlers will only be allowed after the entire practice finishes. - For next day tours, please book no later than 12:00 pm (Japan time) on the previous day. Please place your booking if you agree with the above conditions.
strTitle: Watch a Morning Sumo Training in Tokyo at a Sumo Stable

strIntroduction: There are lots of unique cafes in Tokyo: maid cafe, cat cafe, and Gyaru cafe are the most well known ones. But there is another cafe that will really get your attention: Owl Cafe! An Owl Cafe is a space where you can relax and interact with owls. You can not only touch them but also take pictures with them. Please follow the rules of the cafe and bear in mind that the owls are sensitive animals. Most owl cafes require you to queue up, perhaps for hours on end, in order to experience this "healing entertainment". So, if you'd like to step outside the bustle of Tokyo life and try a uniquely therapeutic experience but don't have hours to throw away, our Japanese concierge team will be happy to make an advance reservation for you at an owl cafe in Central Tokyo. After you make a booking with us we will apply at the cafe for 3 reservation times, and a few days before the requested date will get the result of your application and let you know the exact time and place. Owl cafe takes reservations at the following time slots: 11:00-12:00/ 12:00-13:00/13:00-14:00/14:00-15:00/15:00-16:00/16:00-17:00/17:00-18:00 Available every day for 1-hour visits. Important: Consumption and play time with the birds is charged separately. The exact price depends according to the cafe (usually around 1500 JPY). Grab a seat, choose a drink, pet an owl! Disclaimer: Please note that there might be also other birds depending on the available cafe (such as parrots, hawks, etc).
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe Harajuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Visit in Japan, you will be amazed to find that pachinko parlors are everywhere! Pachinko is the original game similar to pinball and most popular Entertainment in Japan! To play pachinko, players pay and borrow metal balls. Pachinko is the game that how many winning balls you can increase by hitting a Jackpot If you won lots of balls, you can exchange the balls into exciting prizes! Try your luck on the exciting machines! Machine has various design collaboration with popular anime series, movies and more! For example, Gundam, Evangelion, LupinⅢ, Saint Seiya – sooooo many kinds! Find your favorite machines and enjoy the game! Discover the fun of playing pachinko and experience the real Japan! There’s no doubt your trip to Japan will be lots of fun! IMPORTANT! Minors under the age of 18 are NOT allowed to participate in this activity! Smoking and drinking alcohols is strictly prohibited!( We have a separated smoking area.) Please note that you might be together with the other guests. This is not a private activity.
strTitle: 60% OFF Try the Japanese entertainment “Pachinko” in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Starting off in Yurakucho and ending in Shimbashi your guide will show you the sights, sounds and most importantly, tastes of Tokyo most tourists do not get to experience. We will visit Gado Shita ,a lively restaurant district built up under the brick arches beneath the elevated train tracks. Step into the narrow streets of the red lanterns and neon signs, so called yokocho alleys, where you can find yourself back in the 70s of Japan. In such exotic and retro ambience of the Showa period times, you'll see local izakayas mostly frequented by locals. You'll enjoy 5 scrumptious yakitoris and 2 drinks in the first restaurant. Continuing in Ginza, we'll show you some very interesting food spots where you can find a 500 USD melon, some traditionally and beautifully arranged desserts and see the famous landmarks of Tokyo's most expensive real estate area! See how the new glamorous clashes with the rustic old once we set foot in Shimbashi, home to some of the most authentic local eateries and izakayas in Tokyo. Get the chance dine with locals and sample 6-8 dishes you'll surely never forget! This is a food tour you MUST try when visiting Tokyo!
strTitle: Tokyo Walking Food Tour at Night

strIntroduction: Below is the information about the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and the optional add-on Tuna Auction Tour. Please note the Tuna Auction Tour is only available as an add-on with the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. Bookings for same day or the day before is difficult, so please book ahead. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Tsukiji Fish Market Tour: Restaurants in Uogashi-Yokocho were originally for dealers and chefs who visited the market for purchasing their dish ingredients. Recently, those restaurants are earning a well-respected reputation among Japanese citizens and tourists for its fresh and high-quality dishes. Although Uogashi-Yokocho houses appear simple and humble, the long wait lines are proof of the intense popularity for these fresh and reasonably priced sushi dishes. The guide Kiyoshi will guide you every step of the way throughout the fish market, full of endless rows of fish, fruits, and vegetables. He'll teach you the history of Tsukiji and the food industry in Japan from his many years of experience working in hospitality! Detailed Itinerary: 07:00 am - Start Tsukiji Market tour 07:30 am - Fruits and vegetable market 08:00 am - Visit Uogashi Yokocho 08:30 am - Break for breakfast or coffee 09:00 am - "Jogai" or outer market 10:00 am - Explore the Fish market 10:30 am - End of the tour ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Optional Add-on - Tsukiji Tuna Auction: *Closed from mid-December 2015 to beginning of January 2016. Experience the energy and excitement of Tokyo's premier Tuna Auction at the infamous Tsukiji Fish Market with a professional and knowledgable tour guide! The guide Kiyoshi will guide you every step of the way to watch the Tuna Auction and teach you about the history of Tsukiji and the food industry in Japan from his many years of experience working in Japan's Hotel and Food & Beverage industry. Be one of the first people to arrive at the Tuna Auction site at 3am to reserve your spot and see first hand as the early morning brokers check deep inside the famous tuna using flashlights as they assess the quality before the Tuna Auction. Then witness the infamous Tuna Auction between 5:30am and 6:00am. Participants will be able to experience this exciting daily event live and see the extravagant prices paid for high-quality tuna. After watching the Tuna Auction, you will complete your morning with sushi for breakfast at a highly-recommended restaurant. The sushi will surely be the freshest fish you have ever eaten! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Closed Dates in 2015: January 7, 12, 21, 28 February 4, 11, 18, 25 March 4, 11, 25 April 8, 15, 22, 29 May 4, 5, 13, 27 June 3, 10, 17, 24 July 8, 20, 29 August 14, 15, 26 September 9, 21, 22 October 7, 12, 28 November 3, 11, 18, 23 December 9, 23, 31
strTitle: Private Tokyo Tsukiji Market Tour

strIntroduction: If you're interested in Japanese culture, I recommend you to experience a tea ceremony with me! The tea room is located in East Tokyo, near Koiwa or Mizue stations, about 30 minutes by train and city bus from Akihabara Station. You can choose between three types of experiences: 1. Tea ceremony only (60 minutes on average) 2. Kimono experience only (45 minutes on average) 4. Tea ceremony and kimono experience (90-120 minutes in total) The above duration is approximate. strIntroduction: In Japanese, Kiriko, is usually used to refer to cut, polished glass. Cut glass has a long history in Japan dating back nearly 200 years when cut glass, made in Old Tokyo (Edo) was produced and known as Tokyo Cut Glass, or Edo-kiriko. Established in the first half of the 19th century and living on today as a traditional form of Japanese glass art, Kiriko has many kinds of patterns. Patterns engraved as grooves and curves on the glass bend and reflect light, creating a twinkling, glittering show. Cut glass products were brought to Japan by the imagination of artisans in Edo launching them on their own ventures, where they used emery powder as an abrasive. The intricate geometrical lines engraved with minute detail by expert artisans and the vibrant yet transparent colors make Edo-kiriko truly special. When natural light shines through, it takes on a soft gleam, and evening dinner tables are transformed into works of art. You can make Edo-kiriko at "Sumida Edo-kirikokan,” in Tokyo, which opened in 1899. First up, you choose your favorite glass, then you carve traditional Japanese patterns on your glass. After making your own Kiriko, you can keep it and take it home with you. It will be your special memory in Japan. "Sumida Edokirikokan" is open everyday except Sunday and holidays. It will take about 90 minutes to complete your glass. Time start from 10:30, 13:00, and 15:00. ※The fee is non-refundable after booking is confirmed for weekends.
strTitle: Make Old Tokyo Cut Glass in Sumida, Tokyo

strIntroduction: The Shinkansen rail network in Japan is famous around the world for its punctuality, comfort, efficiency, safety and speed. With top speeds around 320 km/h, Japan Rail's bullet train, or shinkansen, is an experience in its own right, as well as a great way to travel. This program is a reservation for shinkansen bullet train ticket in between Tokyo/Odawara with a half day or one day private tour guide. The half day tour includes visits to the highlights of Odawara only, while in the full day version you will be able to additionally travel by bus to Lake Ashi and see the famous spots of Hakone town (bus transportation not included in the price). The tour guide will arrange the trip schedule, so you can request the guide to include the places that you would like to visit. Some famous sightseeing spots for Odawara are as follows: - Odawara Castle Odawara Castle was as an impregnable castle owned by the fifth daimyo of the Hojo clan, the samurai family that governed Kanto area for about a century from the end of 15th century. From the Edo period, the castle became a reserve for Hakone and Tokaido and functioned as a cornerstone of defense in the Kanto region. - Sengoku Hara Sengokuhara is a grassland where visitors can enjoy beautiful natural scenery that changes with the seasons. -Suzuhiro Kamaboko Museum Kamaboko at Suzuhiro Kamaboko Museum is carefully made with fresh fish and natural ingredients without using any preservatives or chemical seasonings. You can enjoy observing the skills of the craftsmen and making kamaboko at the Kamaboko and chikuwa cooking class (reservation required), as well as shopping. Some of the famous sightseeing spots in Hakone for the full day tour: - Hakone Sekisho and the old Tokaido Road The reconstructed former checkpoint of the old Tokaido Road which used to connect Edo (Tokyo) and Kyoto during the Edo period. Here you can see the gates, fences and guardhouses, and even walk a well-preserved passage of the Tokaido Road between giant cedar trees! - Lake Ashi and Hakone Detached Palace The shore of Lake Ashi provides a wonderful view to Mt Fuji and the surrounding mountains. In the beautiful Onshi Hakone Park you can find the Hakone Detached Palace, a former facility of the Imperial family that is know open to the public. - Hakone Shrine The mystic Shinto shrine is surrounded by dense forests and is located at the foot of Mt Komagatake and next to Lake Ashi. See its well-preserved buildings and learn more about the Shinto beliefs from the professional guide. Note: The transportation between Odawara and Hakone (1180 JPY one way) is not included. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station.
