strTitle: Day trip to Odawara/Hakone from Tokyo by Shinkansen

strIntroduction: Winter in Japan offers wonderful opportunities to playing with snow or improving your ski/snowboarding skills! While Tokyo and the Pacific coast of Japan do not get much snow, the other side of the country is well-known as a winter paradise! Particularly popular destination is Niigata prefecture, also known as the Snow Country, home to some of Japan's top ski resorts such as Naeba and Kagura. In this trip you will take a bus from Tokyo and go on a 2-day trip to Mt Naeba before returning back. The tour package includes round-trip bus transportation, one night accommodation at a cosy local lodging or ryokan with dinner and breakfast, and a full day ski lift ticket for both Naeba and Kagura ski resorts! In addition, you will get discounts for equipment rental on the spot. The bus departs a little after 7:00 am from Shinjuku, Tokyo and arrives at Naeba before noon. Enjoy the wonders of the ski resorts before checking in your accommodation and relishing a wonderful dinner with local products. You can spend the entire second day on ski/snowboard before leaving Naeba around 17:30 pm and returning by bus to Tokyo around 21:30 pm. Naeba and Kagura are some of Japan's leading ski resorts with a total of 45 ski slopes (varying by difficulty and length) and 38 lifts! Whether you want to just play with snow, sled or improve your ski/snowboarding skills, Naeba and Kagura will offer the most suitable opportunities for your winter trip. Choose between a standard lodging and a hot spring ryokan. This trip is available from end of December to beginning of April. Note: Rental equipment is included. It is possible to get the equipment at Kinroku Eleven shops only. - wear: size from 90 cm (junior) to 185 cm - board: size from 100 cm to 160 cm - carving ski set: size from 100 cm to 170 cm - boots: size from 18 cm to 29 cm (Japanese shoe size)
strTitle: Book a 2-day trip to one of Japan's top ski resorts Naeba

strIntroduction: Hello, we are a new Japanese cooking class with friendly and knowledgeable local staff here to teach you all about Japanese cooking in Kyoto. Our cooking studio is located in a traditional townhouse which is nicely refurbished, so that you can enjoy a balance of both modern and traditional atmosphere. Learn how to make 4-5 dishes, as well as experience sake and tea tastings. By the end of the class, you will be an expert at authentic Japanese home cooked recipes, and have made new Japanese friends! Morning bento class: 9:30-13:00 Menu: sushi roll, tempura, egg roll, miso soup, salad and another side dish Afternoon izakaya class: 14:00-17:30 Menu: Japanese home cooking class, 5 dishes including salad, rice dish, fish or meat dish, and soup You will get to enjoy the delicious food you cooked at the end of the class.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Cooking Class with Friendly Locals in Kyoto

strIntroduction: If you are planning to visit Kyoto, join us to get in touch with real Japanese traditional culture! We will teach you how to play a song named “Sakura” with Koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) at a 110 years old traditional house, Soushunan. You will experience a 60-minute long lesson and Koto play under the guidance of a professional Koto lecturer. And you will get to take the musical score home with you after the lesson. We will make preparations for the lesson, so you don't need to bring anything.
strTitle: Take a Koto Lesson at a Traditional House in Kyoto

strIntroduction: This is a shuttle service between Narita International Airport and Tokyo/Maihama. After a long flight into Narita Airport, the least thing you wanna do is find out what train route to take or get lost in Japan's complicated railway system. Make the most out of your time and money and book a shared or private shuttle service to take you to Tokyo/Maihama and back to Narita Airport! When you arrive at the pick-up place, you will see the driver waiting for you with your name written on a sign. He will carry your luggage, and lead you to a spacious van, where you can relax and enjoy your shuttle service to your destination in central Tokyo/Maihama. [IMPORTANT] ※You can not decide pick up time. Host will decide and let you know via FAX to your hotel by the previous day. ※The pickup will start 30 minutes after the "actual" flight arrival, and the host will wait for 1 hour, but it will be regarded as no show if guest cannot meet the host by then. ※Shared shuttle service is not available for guests staying at hostels, private residences or capsule hotels. ※Shared shuttle service price is per person. ※Private shuttle service price is per group (up to 4 participants or up to 8 participants) Tokyo 15 wards: Arakawa-ku, Bunkyo-ku, Chiyoda-ku, Chuo-ku, Edogawa-ku, Koto-ku, Meguro-ku, Minato-ku, Ota-ku, Shibuya-ku, Shinagawa-ku, Shinjuku-ku, Sumida-ku, Taito-ku, Toshima-ku Hotel List (as of Nov/6/2016): http://bit.ly/2f6oabm
strTitle: Narita Airport Transfer shuttle service to/from Tokyo, Chiba

strIntroduction: Kyoto's Gion and Higashiyama districts are well-known as the Mecca of geisha art in Japan. Visitors strolling the narrow streets of the neighbourhood at evening time have the chance to spot a geiko (Kyoto geisha) or a maiko (apprentice) entering one of the numerous traditional-style Japanese restaurants or "ochaya" tea houses. Every night there is a private a banquet for small groups who have been granted exclusive access to the "ochaya"teahouse that are not usually open to the general public. Inside the guests are served an authentic Japanese-style are entertained by one or more geiko artists in the most authentic manner. All of this is usually a private and closed-doors event that is offered only to special guests. Tourists typically visit one of the popular public facilities in Gion to watch a maiko stage show, but this in no way resembles the authentic experience of dining in an "ochaya" in the company of a well-trained maiko. By booking this activity you will have the chance to enter private Japanese-style restaurants that are not generally open to everyone. You will be accompanied by a genuine Kyoto geiko and a local interpreter, who has special access to the "ochaya", and will spend about 2 hours in a wonderful and authentic Japanese setting. The maiko artist will casually chat with you, serve you drinks, and even play easy games with you or show you some of her dancing abilities. You will be served top-quality sake. Depending on the season, this activity may include also a visit to a temple to see the night illuminations or to a Japanese garden that is not usually open to public. Your guide will inform you about the seasonal activities when you book. Please note that the maiko does not speak English fluently and you will have a guide-interpreter. Depending on the restaurant, you may be in a private room or in a room with other guests. The authenticity of this experience is guaranteed!
strTitle: Book an exclusive experience in Tea house with a maiko,Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this activity you can enjoy casual and rare winter activities just outside of central Sapporo! Hokkaido's winter landscape offers plenty of opportunities for snow play, ski and snowboarding, but if you want to try something less time-consuming and easy to access, this set of activities is ideal for you and your family! Children are welcome to join and play with the snow too! The winter fun we offer consists of three separate snow activities: 1) a genuine dog sled 2) an attractive and easy to ride snow mobile 3) a snow version of the famous banana boat You will be able to ride the sled and the snow mobile yourself in the wide snow-covered fields just outside of Sapporo. Prior experience is not necessary! English-speaking staff at the local facility will explain everything necessary and will give you the necessary equipment for the ride. All you need to do is bring warm clothes and enjoy Hokkaido's powder snow! It is possible to book the dog sled or the snow mobile separately, but note that each activity takes short time (about 15-20 minutes). We recommend booking the entire set of three experiences. FAQ: Can I ride the snow mobile together with my child? - Yes, as long as you hold the child firmly. Can children experience the dog sled too? - Yes, but for a shorter distance than the usual route. What is the minimum age for these experiences? - Over 13 years for the dog sled regular course (over 3 for a shorter route of 5 minutes). Over 5 years for the banana boat. Over 15 years for the snow mobile (parents are responsible for the safety of the kids). This activity is available every day from January 7 until March 20, from 10 am to 4 pm. You can reach the facility by taking a bus bound for Jozankei from Sapporo Station's bus terminal. The bus ride takes about 50 minutes. Get off at Toyotaki Shougakko bus stop (豊滝小学校) from where the local staff will pick you up by car. Please inform us which bus you will ride from Sapporo in order to inform the local facility about the time you will arrive for the pick-up. Below you can find the timetable of the bus from Sapporo: Bus bound for Jozankei: Sapporo (leaves) - Toyotaki Shougakko 豊滝小学校 (arrives) 7:00 - 7:57 7:30 - 8:28 8:00 - 8:51 8:30 - 9:21 10:00 - 10:57 12:00 - 12:58 13:00 - 13:59 15:30 - 16:30 Note: the cost of the bus is not included in the activity price.
strTitle: Ride a dog sled, snow mobile and a banana boat near Sapporo!

strIntroduction: The Ouchijuku post station built in 1640 is where feudal lords would stay on their trips to Edo (Tokyo). The buildings and scenery have been retained and it is open to the public for sightseeing. It is filled with souvenir shops and restaurants. One popular dish is the "negisoba" buckwheat noodle dish eaten with a Welsh onion instead of chopsticks. In winter, the ground is covered in snow and the light-decorated scenery is truly magical. Have an experience you will never forget. This special 2 day, 1 night tour guides you through Ouchijuku in a chartered bus or taxi. You will stay at a hotel in front of Aizu-Wakamatsu Station that is a great location for sightseeing during the day. Schedule: Day 1 Check-in individually at the hotel in front of Aizu-Wakamatsu Station. 19:00-22:30: Ouchijuku night tour departing from Aizu-Wakamatsu Station at night (Accompanied only by a driver.) After end of tour; stay overnight at the hotel in front of Aizu-Wakamatsu Station. Day 2 After check-out individually at the hotel in front of Aizu-Wakamatsu Station, free time. Note: On February 18 you will visit Nakayama Setsugetsuka, instead of Ouchijuku. Nakayama Setsugetsuka is a unique festival, known as one of Japan's best night views, in which many candles are spread throughout a vast snowy field in the night. Please note that there will be no dinner on this tour. However, you will receive a small present/souvenir. Important! Minimum of 2 people per booking.
strTitle: 2-day tour: See the magical snow-covered Ouchijuku at night

strIntroduction: This program offers one day tours that depart from Kanazawa to Shirakawago, Kanazawa to Shirakawago and Gokayama, and Kanazawa to Shirakawago and Takayama. The tour for Shirakawago and Takayama will take you to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites (Shirakawago village and Ainokura village), as well as to Fukumitsu town in Toyama where you will stroll the traditional shopping street Sasaraya and will try making your own senbei rice crackers. The tour for Takayama will include a visit to one of Japan's best preserved traditional old towns, and home to one of the country's three most famous festivals (Takayama Festival). The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago and Gokayama is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 13:15-14:30 Free time at Ainokura village in Gokayama 15:15-15:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 16:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago and Takayama is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 13:00 or 13:45 (depends on the season) Free time at Takayama 16:15-16:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 17:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago only is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 16:15-16:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 17:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. ※Tour schedule is not fixed. Your host will announce if the tour will be held 5 days prior to the activity date.
strTitle: Book a One Day Trip to Shirakawago, Gokayama, or Takayama!

strIntroduction: Our team "Local Tour Concierge" can provide private and only one tour for you. Please choose and combine from below list, We can make tour for you based on your request;) Sightseeing spots 1) Tsukiji fish market 2) Harajuku 3) Asakusa 4) Akihabara 5) Shibuya 6) Shinjuku 7) Ueno 8) Imperial pales 9) Yanaka shopping street Food Places 1) Ramen place 2) Sushi place 3) Teppanyaki place 4) Beef bowl place Shopping 1) Shoes 2) Japanese traditional souvenir(Chopsticks/cup/etc,,) 3) Closes(Jackets/shirts/etc) 4) Japanese snacks to take back to your country 5) Electrical goods Museum&Activity 1)Edo-Tokyo museum in Ryogoku (¥1350 per person) 2)Samurai museum in Shinjuku (¥1800 per person) 3)Wearing Real Kimono activity in Asakusa (¥3500 per person) 4)Riding Mario kart activity (Need driving license) (2 hours/¥4000) If you have more request, please feel free to ask us;) Specific description: - Asakusa. You can walk and eat at Nakamise street which looks like old Edo Tokyo. If you want you can pull a good luck charm called Omikuji at Sensoji Temple. This is the best spot if you like the image of old Japan. - Ueno Park. It's a cultural mecca with a number of museums including the prestigious Tokyo National Museum and the delightful Shitamachi Museum with its display of old Tokyo, Ueno Zoo and many galleries. We goes to SHINOBASULAKE and around park. - Shibuya. Here is the most famous scramble intersection. You can visit many attractive shops. - Shinjuku. You can shop at the biggest and cheapest shopping center called Don Quixote. - Izakaya"WATAMI" (bring cash with you). This is a Japanese bar called Izakaya. You can spend a great night here. We promise you reasonable prices. Izakaya is a Japanese-style pub popular among working people, which offers a variety of foods.
strTitle: 10% OFF Tour all the popular places in Tokyo with a local!

strIntroduction: We have simple, antique, latest fashion, distinct design and colors. Also, we have a kimono which is like those used in Japanese historical plays. With kimono, it is possible to mix and match a lot of different designs and colors, especially with obi (belt). For example, you can match an antique kimono design with the latest obi (belt) design, and so on. You will certainly enjoy making such coordination. Kimono is a magical dress, unique to Japan. When you wear kimono, you will feel attractive and charming, Japanese “kawaii”, in a special Japanese way. Of course, kimono is beautiful to look at, but it is even more beautiful to wear. We have experienced staff that can provide a basic hair-setting service. You can explore Tokyo in your kimono! In particular, Shibuya has many great places to visit, such as the “scramble” intersection and Hachiko (the famous dog statue), which are very popular for taking pictures. Our staff will take some souvenir photos. We also recommend you to visit Meiji Shirine and Takeshita Street in Harajuku. We can keep our customers luggage, but please take your valuables with you. Rental is normally up to 4 hours - enough time to enjoy exploring Shibuya or Harajuku. The rental time begins after the customer has been completely dressed in kimono and upon leaving our store. Please return to our store approximately four hours after leaving it. The time it takes for our customers to change out of kimono and into their regular clothing is not considered part of the rental time. Choose between the Basic plan (kimono) and the Kawaii plan (long-sleeved furisode). If you are not able to return your kimono within 4 hours of the rental start time, you can rent it till 6:00 pm. In this case please book the add-in Overtime option. If you rent a kimono and keep it till the next day at 6:00 pm. In this case please book the add-on Overnight option. Business Hours 10:00 am to 6:00 pm (Sunday to Thursday) 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm (Saturday) ,Holiday Friday
strTitle: Dress in Kimono & take pictures at the Shibuya crossing

strIntroduction: Spend some time petting and taking pictures with adorable owls at this owl cafe in Osaka. Owl cafes are a new type of themed cafe that are becoming increasingly popular all over Japan. Even if you don't think of yourself particularly as an owl lover, these adorable birds will surely steal your heart. Before meeting the owls, you'll have a chance to order a drink of your preference, before a member of the staff carefully explains the proper way to handle the owl to avoid any harm to you and the owl. Please listen attentively to their explanation so that you can enjoy an amazing time with the owls. Here is the flow of the experience: - enter the shop and hear the instructions of the staff (first 15 minutes of the experience) - spend time with the owls (for about 35 minutes) - end of the experience You'll then need to clean your hands with hand sanitizer before you can touch and pet the owls. After your time is up, you'll be able to visit the gift shop and find a unique owl-related souvenir! Other rules to observe: - only the staff can bring and take away the owls. - don't let go off the leash. - avoid touching the owls anywhere else except for their heads. - turn off the flash when taking a photo. This is definitely a rare, unique experience that you should definitely not miss while you are visiting Japan! Reserve your seat now! It is also possible to rent the entire place for 1 hour! Available for up to 20 people at once! The opening time of the cafe in Osaka is as follows: Weekday: 12:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Weekend: 11:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Closed: Mondays
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe "Fukuro no Mise" in Osaka

strIntroduction: If you have not been to any historical sites in Kyoto yet, this tour is for you! This tour will cover visiting the historical sites in Kyoto in one day! Kyoto was Japan’s capital for over 1,000 years, and the historical scents of Japan still remain. Kyoto has a stunning collection of UNESCO World Heritage sites and also a geisha district. The temples and traditions are outstanding, but the food is also exquisite! This tour will take you to famous tourists spots in Kyoto in one day. A professional guide will show you around safely, while presenting you with important and interesting information about the historical sites and about the city in general. Detailed itineraries: 9:00 Meet up at your hotel 9:15 Fushimi Inari Shrine (60mins) - Fushimi Inari Shrine is an important Shinto shrine in southern Kyoto. - It is famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates, which straddle a network of trails behind its main buildings. - The trails lead into the wooded forest of the sacred Mount Inari, which stands at 233 meters and belongs to the shrine grounds. - Foxes are thought to be Inari's messengers, resulting in many fox statues across the shrine grounds. 11:00 Kiyomizu temple (60mins) - Kiyomizudera is one of the most celebrated temples of Japan. - It was found in 780 on the site of the Otowa Waterfall in the wooded hills, east of Kyoto, and derives its name from the fall's pure water. - In 1994, the temple was added to the list of UNESCO world heritage sites. - Kiyomizudera is best known for its wooden stage that juts out from its main hall, 13 meters above the hillside below. - The stage affords visitors a nice view of the numerous cherry and maple trees below that erupt in a sea of color during the spring and fall, as well as of the city of Kyoto in the distance. - The main hall, which together with the stage was built without the use of nails, houses the temple's primary object of worship, a small statue of the eleven faced, thousand armed Kannon. Kiyomizu temple → Ninen-zaka-Sannen-zaka area → Kodaiji temple → Yasaka Shrine (90mins) - Just downhill from and slightly to the north of Kiyomizu-dera, you will find one of Kyoto’s loveliest restored neighborhood, the Ninen-zaka-Sannen-zaka area. - The name refers to the two main streets of the area: Ninen-zaka and Sannen-zaka, literally ‘Two-Year Hill’ and ‘Three-Year Hill’ (the years referring to the ancient imperial years when they were first laid out). - These two charming streets are lined with old wooden houses, traditional shops and restaurants. - If you fancy a break, there are many tea houses and cafes along this lane. - Kodaiji is an outstanding temple in Kyoto's Higashiyama District. - It was established in 1606 in memory of Toyotomi Hideyoshi, one of Japan's greatest historical figure, by Hideyoshi's wife Nene who is also enshrined at the temple. - Yasaka Shrine is one of the most famous shrines in Kyoto. Found over 1350 years ago, the shrine is located between the popular Gion District and Higashiyama District, and is often visited by tourists walking between the two districts. - You will have lunch somewhere around this area. - If you have any preferences or need a recommendation, feel free to ask the guide! 13:30 Gion (60mins) - Gion is Kyoto's most famous geisha district, located around Shijo Avenue between Yasaka Shrine in the east and the Kamo River in the west. - It is filled with shops, restaurants and ochaya (teahouses), where geiko(Kyoto dialect for geisha) and maiko (geiko's apprentices) entertain their customers with traditional dances, songs, and games. 15:15 Kinkakuji (60misn) - Visit the Golden Pavilion, a Zen temple, whose top floors are completely covered in gold leaf - It was the retirement villa of the shogun, Ashikaga Yoshimitsu, and according to his will it became a Zen temple of the Rinzai sect after his death in 1408. - It is a detailed architecture incorporating three distinct styles of shinden, samurai, and zen. 17:00 Arrive at Kyoto Station Why we love it: - Don't have enough time to travel around? No worries! Visit famous sightseeing sites in one day! - Take a tour with a knowledgeable English-speaking local guide with years of experience. - Strap on your adventurous spirit and immerse yourself in Kyoto - You will never forget the beauty of Kyoto! - You will enjoy wandering around Kyoto with the professional guide, since the professional guide will show you around the area with important and interesting information, and also about the Japanese culture! - Don't miss this opportunity to travel around Kyoto in one day! - Since this tour is a one day trip, you can do other activities on the next day! Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! Photos by: - https://flic.kr/p/tAUJE - https://flic.kr/p/ifGEsp - https://flic.kr/p/enJMBg - https://flic.kr/p/6xnSus - https://flic.kr/p/nk2NGx - https://flic.kr/p/6v4cji
strTitle: 1 Day Tour Around Historical Sites in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Hedgehog café is located in the Roppongi district in Tokyo, and it's a place where you can touch, pet and take photos with cute little hedgehogs! It has become one of the most popular animal cafes in Tokyo and a must for animal lovers! Even if this is your first time playing with hedgehogs, there's nothing to worry about. Before you interact with them, the staff will carefully demonstrate how to scoop up the hedgehogs into your hands. It might seem like it's a little difficult to handle them at first, but you'll get used to it after a few minutes! Did you know that hedgehogs come in several colors? At this cafe, you can befriend multi-colored hedgehogs such as "Salt n' Pepper", "Pied", and "Cinnamon". The baby hedgehogs are super cute! Don't forget to bring your camera and take photos with them to show off to family and friends! We are certain that you'll miss these cute little friends so much when you get home. There are no drink and food menu at the hedgehog cafe but there is a self-service drink bar so feel free to help yourself. Also you can bring your own food and drink (soft drinks only), so why don't you visit and chill out with tiny adorable hedgehogs? Since the hedgehog cafe is getting more and more popular, reservation is mandatory, especially during the weekends – so please go ahead and reserve your time slot through our reservation system! It will be an incredible memory of your time in Japan. Reservation slot: 12:00 pm-1:00 pm 1:00 pm-2:00 pm 2:00 pm-3:00 pm 3:00 pm-4:00 pm 4:00 pm-5:00 pm 5:00 pm-6:00 pm 6:00 pm-7:00 pm 7:00 pm-8:00 pm * Children under 12 must be accompanied by parents or guardian at all times.
strTitle: Play with cute hedgehogs at a cafe in Roppongi, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Below is the schedule of this mainstream Tokyo tour: 10:00 Meet at your Hotel 11:00 Imperial Palace East Garden 12:30 Lunch at Harajuku / Omotesando 13:30 Meiji Jingu Shrine 14:30 Harajuku Fashion "KAWAII" costume shops 16:00 Asakusa Sensoji Temple 17:00 Tour Ends Tour Duration: 7 Hours Maximum Number of People: 6 Tour Type: Transport Based Tour Highlights: Edo Castle: the residence of the Tokugawa shogun during the Edo period. After the Meiji restoration it became the Tokyo Imperial Palace. Meiji Jingu Shrine: the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji (1852-1912）and Empress Shoken are enshrined. The Meiji era is the period of Japanese modernization started. Harajyuku Takeshita-dori, young fashion district, visit costume shops. Asakusa Senso-ji Temple: Tokyo’s oldest temple located in Shitamachi, old town where I live; we will explore the surrounding streets with a sense of the old local culture which links to Edo period and early Tokyo. There are many good local restaurants and interesting bars; a pleasant place to conclude the tour. The tour does not extend into the evening, but I will be available to make suggestions for where to eat your evening meal or I would join you. Tour Inclusions: Services of a professional Japanese Tour Guide who will meet you at your hotel. Tour Exclusions: Travel costs (buses, subway, JR or taxis.) Admission costs Your lunch is not included.
strTitle: 60% OFF See Tokyo: Imperial Palace, Harajuku, Asakusa

strIntroduction: In my lesson ・practice basic brash technics of Japanese calligraphy. ・learn how to write your name with Japanese characters and Chinese characters(kanji) and practice. ・learn how to write letter you choice Chinese characters and practice. ・create souvenir.
strTitle: Japanese Calligraphy in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Kawaii Monster Cafe in Harajuku, Tokyo, opened in the summer of 2015 under the concept of "swallowing everything around the fashion mecca like a monster" and represents a distinctively new approach to pop-art and dining. The cafe was born as a creation of the widely acclaimed modern art designer Sebastian Masuda who fascinates the world with his peculiar take on "kawaii" (cuteness). Having previously worked on the music videos of the famous J-pop star Kyary Pamyu Pamyu, Sebastian Masuda incorporated his edgy vision of art and fashion into a flashy colourful interior that suits the concept of engulfing the trendiest urban cultures in Tokyo. Visitors enter the Kawaii Monster Cafe through the mouth of a giant monster and find themselves inside a gaudy space of glitter, clashing colours and unique design. Lovers of contemporary pop-art will be thrilled to discover edgy installations such as the cake-shaped merry-go-round, and will continue to explore the different areas of this crazy cafe: - Mushroom Disco, a space in which giant poisonous mushrooms coexist with colourful candies as part of the interior. - Milk Stand, where cute but slightly twisted figures of animals drink from baby milk bottles. - Bar Experiment, the deep sea world surrounded by glowing jellyfish tentacles. - Mel-Tea Room, where ants lead the guests to melting ice cream and sweets. The food and drinks served here complement the wacky interior and guarantee that guests will have an unforgettable dining experience of fashion and art. In addition, Kawaii Monster Cafe is home to five mascot Monster Girls whose visual appearance helps create an atmosphere of a fascinating otherworldliness. They will help the guest find their seat into this labyrinth of colours and shapes, and recommend the best of the artistic menu. A visit to Kaiwaii Monster Cafe is strongly recommended for all visitors to Tokyo who wish to experience something extraordinary while acquainting themselves with the latest trends in Harajuku's urban pop-culture and fashion. Choose between the following options when booking: <Seat reservation only>...Available any time on any day. <Seat and dinner reservation>...Available for dinner time from Monday to Saturday. <Seat, dinner, all-you-can-drink reservation>...Available for dinner time from Monday to Saturday. Lunch time: 11:30 - 16:30 (last entry until 15:30, 90 minutes stay) Dinner: 18:00 - 22:30 (last order until 22:00). During busy days the lunch time is limited to 90 minutes/dinner to 2 hours. Average Cost - 2,500 JPY (you can choose the menu on the day if you book seat reservation only)
strTitle: Reservation for Kawaii Monster Cafe Harajuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Kyoto was the second capital of Japan from 794-1868 with 72 Emperors and 3 Shoguns legacy. Many national treasures and important cultural assets are the remains of such history. Needless to say, there are many hidden and interesting sites to explore in Kyoto. Samurai guide, Joe Okada will introduce some of the aforementioned sites on this tour. As an experienced tour guide, Joe Okada knows Kyoto inside out. He personally escorts you for 4 km, walked in about 5 hours. Let’s enjoy cool Kyoto with the cool samurai! Schedule: 9:45 We will meet at Kyoto City Hall Plaza. You can reach Kyoto City Hall Plaza from Kyoto Shiyakusho-Mae Station (station number T12) on the subway Tozai Line. 10:00 We will walk along Teramachi Street and visit various specialty shops including those with wood engravings, the best paper and tea, and Japanese brushes and inks. You will also have the opportunity to visit a Shinto shrine and a Buddhist temple. 11:30 We will then walk through the Kyoto Imperial Palace forest and enjoy a special visit to the Shusui-tei garden, complete with a centuries-old tea house for nobility. We will walk by the 25 million dollar Kyoto State Guest House, where U.S. President George W. Bush had a press conference in 2005. 13:00 We will relax and enjoy the “Face to Face Market” and try some pre-arranged sample foods! 14:30 You will have the opportunity to watch a very rare samurai sword demonstration, "Cutting Apple in Air," by Samurai Joe. 15:00 The tour disbands. You may revisit the shops, or visit nearby sites including Daitokuji, Ginkakuji, and Nijo Castle. Availability: Group Tour - Every Saturday Semi Private Tour - Your requested date except Saturday I offer this tours every Saturday for groups of 10 people or more. If your group is smaller then 10, please inquire as you may still be able to join the tour with others. Also, you can book your own private tour at a flat rate on Saturdays and weekdays - please ask! *Children under 12 years are free but they need to cover food fee in cash for 1000 JPY.
strTitle: Cool Kyoto Walking Tour with the Last Samurai

strIntroduction: Form Practice First of all, you need to learn basic skills to handle Katana with wooden Katana before cutting the Goza mat. With this step, every participants will learn the right posture, form and grip. Wield a real Katana (Japanese sword) After learning the basics, next step is wieldind a real Katana, and cut a Goza mat. You might have seen this kind of show on movie (perhaps on YouTube), putting a Goza mat vertically, and slice the mat. Zen (meditation) As a wrap up of this course, all participants learn Zen meditation with Singing Bowl. Singing Bowl is a type of bell which produce sounds that lead to a calm state of mind. Through this meditation, you can learn how to meditate in Zen way, and experience deep meditation with Singing Bowl. You can choose to book a 120-minute version with kimono or a shorter 90-minute version without kimono. Available to book every day. Minimum 2 people per booking.
strTitle: 10% OFF Authentic Kyoto Samurai Experience
Explore Art and Design in Tokyo on Customised Tours

strIntroduction: Special Announcement!! Voyagin offers the tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers and free pick up service from following area. Be sure to reach at least 5 minutes prior to departure time. In this 1-day bus tour, you can not only explore the fascinating Mt.Fuji, the UNESCO World Heritage, but also visit Lake Kawaguchi and Oshino Ninja Village, which makes your travel in Japan more enjoyable and unforgettable! Don't miss this chance to see the jaw-dropping scenery of Japan's iconic Mt.Fuji. Lake Kawaguchi is one of Fuji Goko (Five Fuji Lakes) and famous for the best view of Mt. Fuji in this area and offers a splendid and breathtaking scenery. Oshino Hakkai consists of eight ponds filled by the underground spring water from Mt. Fuji. The area is well worth exploring due to its beauty and nature. While there you can't miss Oshino Shinobi no Sato (Oshino Ninja Village), a Ninja theme park that was opened in 2015. There, you will be able to appreciate a Japanese traditional garden in addition to experiencing several activities in Ninja style and enjoy delicious Japanese food with local ingredients. The highlight of the tour is visiting Mt. Fuji's 5th Station! Depending on the weather conditions, the scenery is spectacular! The time you spend here will undoubtedly be a special memory. The excitement of the tour continues with a 4D movie at Fuji-Q Highland which simulates an airplane flying over Mt. Fuji. After the bus tour is over, there will be enough time for you to enjoy the rest of the evening in Tokyo. --Brief itinerary-- 8:20 Depart from the meeting point in Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower) 10:00-10:30 Lake Kawaguchi Enjoy the natural reflecting pool for Mt. Fuji! 11:05-11:45 Oshino Hakkai (Oshino Eight Ponds) See the beautiful ponds with the view of Mt.Fuji! 11:50-13:00 Oshino Shinobi no Sato (Oshino Ninja Village) Explore traditional Japanese culture and take photos with Ninja! 13:45-14:15 Mt. Fuji 5th Station Get the closest view of Mt.Fuji and take photos that you can show it off to your friends! 14:55-15:40 4D experience at Fuji-Q Highland This will definitely be one of the most astonishing experience in this tour! 17:00-17:30 End of the tour at Shinjuku Station south exit --Notices-- ・The tour is operated daily from March 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016. (Except Apr 29 - May 1, May 3 - 5, May 7, Jul 16, Aug 6, Aug 11 - 14, Sep 3, Sep 17 - 18, Sep 22 - 24, Oct 8, Dec 23) ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・There is a tour in English and Japanese. ・There is multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese and Thai available. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If any place is closed, we will try to replace it with an alternative place. ・If we are not able to go to Mt. Fuji 5th Station due to the weather, we will attend the highest point on road there.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus Tour to Mt.Fuji & Meet Ninja from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: "Taiko" is a Japanese drum that can be heard playing its bold and earth shaking sound at many festivals here in Tokyo. Even from a distance, the sound of Taiko can be heard and felt. In this activity, you will learn how to play Taiko from a professional teacher who has played Taiko for almost 30 years. He has performed world wide and is very knowledgeable. This activity includes lessons of other musical instruments like the Takebue (flute constructed of bamboo) as well. No prior experience or knowledge is required to join this activity. I can sometimes meet special requests, but our regular class times are: Tue, Fri (19:00 - 20:30) Thu (10:30 - 12:00) Sun (12:30 - 14:00) If you would like a private class, please book the anytime class options. *Closed on Wed & Sat LOCATION: About 10 minutes walk from Ryogoku Station, which is served by the JR East Chūō-Sōbu Line and the Toei Oedo Line. It is numbered as station E-12.
strTitle: Learn to Play the Taiko drum in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This tour is perfect for those who naturally rise in the early morning, or for those who just want to have a unique experience and don't mind getting up early for it. We start at the world famous Fushimi Inari Shrine and what a special time to see this amazing place. There are thousands of red gates which line the path up the hillside. With the low early light casting long shadows here we can get some truly fantastic photos before all the crowds arrive. From there we will visit Kiyomizu Temple, one of the oldest temples in Kyoto and a true gem. This is the most popular temple in Kyoto or maybe even Japan so it is a real treat to get there before the crowds and get a spectacular view of the city below. After that we make our way to Arashiyama by train and get to see the beautiful bamboo grove which if we are lucky will still be relatively quiet and great for getting some fantastic photos or just to stop and listen to the soundscape of the branches swaying in the wind. Before leaving Arashiyama, we make a visit to one of the most beautiful zen temples in Kyoto, Tenryuji Temple a world heritage site with a radiant garden. A view that you will surely cherish for years to come. Along the way we give you insights about Buddhism, Japanese garden design, history and more. We are also happy to help you with any questions you have about Kyoto or Japan and can even help you plan your days ahead.
strTitle: See the morning freshness of Kyoto in an early bird tour

strIntroduction: This is an activity where you'll learn about Japan's religions, customs, shrines and temples. I will accompany you to a notable shrine and temple in Japan then tell you the correct manners at each of these places as well as their history/culture. For the basic plan, I'll take you to a shrine such as the Meiji Shrine that was founded in 1920 after the Emperor's death. I'll also take you to a temple such as the Zojoji temple that was founded in 1393 and later became Tokugawa Shogunate's family temple. I will give you in-depth information about traditional Japanese culture that is even un-known to the local Japanese people.
strTitle: Guided Tour of Shrines and Temples

strIntroduction: Special offer only for Voyagin guests! We offer this tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers. Don't miss this chance to enjoy one day bus tour exploring most of the best tourist spots in Tokyo in a day at a valuable price! Halal food lunch is also available! If you are looking for an adventurous sightseeing bus tour, here it is! This bus tour covers famous sightseeing spots in Tokyo. Enjoy the traditional Japanese garden at the Imperial Palace for the start of your tour, it will take your breath away and you’ll enjoy a peaceful and carefree feeling while you are there. The Sensoji temple and Kaminari-mon gate in Asakusa are a must-see, the magnificent structure of the temple is overwhelming. You will also be able to experience the enthusiastic atmosphere of Tsukiji Fish Market on this bus tour. Although the Tokyo Bay Cruise is only 20-minutes long, its full of excitement, and the view from under the Rainbow bridge will be unforgettable. After the cruise, it's shopping time! Prepare a shopping list, so you won’t miss out on what you want. While you are on the bus, the excitement will be continuous. The bus will pass by the National Diet, Ameyoko open-air market, Tokyo Skytree, Kabuki-za Theater and much more. It's absolutely amazing to visit all those sightseeing spots in one day!! --Brief itinerary-- 8:30 Depart from the meeting point at Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower at 8:25) 9:00-9:40 Imperial Palace East Garden Relax and feel the breeze in the greenery. 10:15-11:15 Sensoji Temple, Asakusa Explore one of the most famous temples in Japan! 12:00-12:45 Tsukiji Fish Market Enjoy world famous fish market in the tour. 13:15-14:40 Aqua City Odaiba Enjoy shopping, not to forget this fantastic memory of the tour! Have lunch and choose between a buffet style meal or a Halal lunch! 14:45-15:05 Tokyo Bay Cruise See the fascinating view of Tokyo Bay! You have choices where to get off the bus. Choices are from Ginza, Shinbashi, Tokyo Tower, Shibuya, and Harajuku. 16:00 The final stop is Shinjuku Station south exit. --Notices--. ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・A tour assistant in English and Japanese is available. ・A multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese and Thai is available. ・Itinerary order is subject to change depending on traffic and weather. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If a sightseeing spot is closed, we will replace it with an alternative place. ・If you prefer Halal Lunch, the booking must be made 3 days in advance. The tour is free for children 5 years and below.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus Tour Around Best Tourist Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This new style of Japanese entertainment has taken Roppongi by storm! Oiran (traditional Japanese courtesans), samurai and geisha dance across the kaleidoscopic rotating stage in a series of beautiful, exciting Japanese-style performances. The cast of 11 professional dancers and drag queens will bring the sensuality of Tokyo's old "pleasure quarters" to life during this exciting 50 minute show. Enjoy drinks in the expansive premises and prepare yourself for a night of fun antics.
