strIntroduction: Following a pick-up at your hotel or Hiroshima Station, you will take a JR local train to Miyajima-guchi and change to a ferry boat. Miyajima is one of the three most beautiful places in Japan. You will walk around the island to see the Great Torii Gate, Itsukushima Shrine, and Taishoin Temple. We will have lunch on the island. After Miyajima, you will take a tram to visit the Peace Memorial Park. Hiroshima is well known as the city where the first atomic bomb was dropped. You will walk around the park to see some monuments such as the Children's Peace Monument, Peace Bell, and Flame of Peace. Then you will visit the museum to learn about what happened on August 6, 1945. As this is a private tour, I will be flexible depending on your preferences. If you have questions, please feel free to contact me!
strTitle: Explore Miyajima & Hiroshima in a Full Day Tour

strIntroduction: The Aokigahara Jukai, “the sea of trees", spreads across the northwest foot of Mt. Fuji, and is a forest growing atop the lava that flowed during the eruption of Mt. Fuji in 864 (the great eruption of the Jougan era), some 1,150 years ago. The Aokigahara Forest spans approximately 3,000 hectares but the soil has lain quite thin. The roots of the trees do grow horizontally seeking nutrition. It is also a highly unusual forest in which it is comprised primarily of hemlock fir, Japanese cypress, and other evergreen needle leaf trees, and broadleaf trees such as longstalk holly, Japanese andromeda, oak, Fuji cherry, and maple. This tour will take you on a walking tour to experience the sea of trees. Your guide, who is an expert of Aokigahara will provide you with interesting facts about the area and will show you around safely. You can choose the duration of the tour: A) 2 hours Course B) 3 hours Course C) 4 hours Course Why we love it: - A professional guide will walk through Aokigahara with you while presenting you with some important and interesting information about Aokigahara. - Feel the nature, and discover the woods! - Enjoy the forest bathing. - Listen to the sound of the forest and wild birds' singing. - Go inside the Wind Cave and Ice Cave. - The scene of the film "The Forest" is in the Aokigahara. - Discover the newborn lives of trees in the beautiful Aokigahara Forest!! This tour will make your trip unforgettable! Visit this wonderful forest full of amazing scenery, clean air, and a friendly guide! Every season is available. ※This activity does not offer child fee. overview icon 集合場所 Meeting place A) 2 hours Course FUGAKU FUKETSU (Wind Cave) bus stop 〒401-0332 Yamanashi Prefecture, Minamitsuru District, 富士河口湖町西湖青木ヶ原2068−1 B) 3-4 hours Course KAWAGUCHIKO station ※The exact meeting point will be decided by your guide after booking, but will be the Fugaku Fuketsu (Wind Cave) Bus Stop in Yamanashi prefecture. 重要事項 Important Information Please book 2 days before the date you are planning to join. Please note that transportation from Kawaguchiko Station to Fugaku Fuketsu bus stop is not included. You may need to take the local bus (about 670 JPY one way) or a taxi. Please prepare cash in advance because there are few ATMs around the forest.
strTitle: Explore Aokigahara, the Sea of Beautiful Trees!

strIntroduction: Kamogawa Sea World is an amusement park with a collection of 11,000 marine creatures from 800 different species. In the themed display zones, visitors can come into contact with these creatures in environments that replicate as closely as possible their marine habitats. This includes things such as an eco-aquarium, which recreates the habitats in Japanese rivers as they flow to the sea, a tropical island which displays tropical coral and South Pacific fish, and an enormous shore reef, where a variety of marine mammals and penguins live. Prepare to be surprised and impressed as killer whales jump energetically and toss their trainer into the air, while beluga and dolphins achieve startling feats in the water, and sea lions perform a uniquely comic show. Other attractions include the pelicans going for their daily walk, night adventures, and areas where you can interact with the creatures, taking photographs with them and petting them. The park features the only restaurant in Japan where you can watch killer whales swimming past as you eat, as well as a restaurant overlooking the Pacific Ocean, making diners feel as though they are on a cruise ship. There are also a number of gift shops with an array of exclusive products. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo or urban Chiba to Kamogawa Sea World? The tour fare includes the round trip JR ticket (day trip), and admission to Kamogawa Sea World. You can also choose to include lunch at a reasonable price. There is a free shuttle bus between Awa-Kamogawa Station and Kamogawa Sea World. It takes approximately 10 minutes.
strTitle: Interact with Sea Animals in Kamogawa Sea World, Chiba!

strIntroduction: Burlesque Tokyo is a unique night-time entertainment in the heart of Roppongi, Tokyo. Only here and only with our special offer you can enjoy 90 wonderful minutes of glamorous entertainment, exciting atmosphere and as many drinks as you want! Burlesque Tokyo is a very popular night club which has been recently becoming well-known among foreign visitors and guests of Tokyo. This is one of the best places to have a party and enjoy a truly hot entertainment with Tokyo's most attractive girls! Our professional dancers are top-class performers and will amaze you with their stage skills. In addition, Burlesque Tokyo is one of the very few places in Japan where tipping is not only allowed, but encouraged - you can freely tip the girls and show them how much you enjoy their attractive show! The show takes about 90 minutes and includes an "all you can drink" plan and 10 tips that you can give to the girls. There are three shows per day. When you book, please choose the show you want to visit (you can stay and watch only one show). First show Entrance: 18:30 (singers and pole dancers will heat up the venue before the main show) Main show: 19:20 End of show: 20:30 Second show Entrance: 21:00 (singers and pole dancers will heat up the venue before the main show) Main show: 21:20 End of show: 22:30 Third show Entrance: 23:00 (singers and pole dancers will heat up the venue before the main show) Main show: 23:20 End of show: 24:30 On Sunday only the first two shows are held. Please note that there is no public transportation available after the end of the third show and you can return to your hotel by taxi only. Please note that you cannot stay longer and you will be asked to leave the club after the end of the show. You cannot pay additionally to sit for another show. The venue closes at 1:00 am. The price of this amazing show at Burlesque Tokyo is specially discounted for Voyagin visitors! Don't miss your chance to experience one of Tokyo's greatest night-time entertainment shows! IMPORTANT: No sexual services are offered at Burlesque Tokyo. You are not allowed to touch the dancers during or after the performance, except for tipping them. You must be at least 20-year-old to enter and watch the show.
strTitle: 30% OFF Burlesque Tokyo's Grand Show!

strIntroduction: After a long walk and tour around the city, how about a relaxing, romantic cruise to end your day? Come join us for an hour-long cruise at Tokyo Bay. The cruise usually starts from 9:30 pm, but sometimes the cruise starts from 9:00 (please inquire before booking if you can only make 9:30 pm). Simply meet at the yacht club 30 minutes prior for check-in! You can come after you tour around Tokyo, or after a hard day's work. You can enjoy a nice drink at the bar counter, and we serve many types of drinks from alcohol to non-alcohol. Take your drink up to the top deck of the ship, and feel the breeze while you gaze into the night view of Tokyo. Sit around in the seats and have a delightful conversation with your partner or friends, and make this the most memorable moment of your stay in Tokyo. Enjoy this luxurious experience with your favorite person, friends, or family. ※For night cruise, passenger need to be 6 years old and above.
strTitle: Tokyo Bay Night Cruise

strIntroduction: Game maker Capcom's official watering hole, the Capcom Bar, serves up food and drinks inspired by its iconic video games such as Resident Evil, Ace Attorney and Monster Hunter. This bar reproduces the Capcom game series. Food and drinks are also unique and created in the likeliness your favorite games. For example, you will see brain cake from BioHazard, burned meat from Monster Hunter, and meatballs from Street Fighter! Grab a spoon, and let's visit the Capcom Bar Game World in Tokyo! There are 5 time slots evaryday. 1. 11:30~ 2. 14:00~ 3. 16:30~ 4. 19:00~ 5. 21:30~ Photo Credit; http://flic.kr/p/bjperB http://flic.kr/p/bjpetc http://flic.kr/p/fg3vCT http://flic.kr/p/bjq1YX http://flic.kr/p/9SwHVs
strTitle: Reservation for the Game World at the Capcom Bar in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The rabbit cafe, Ms. BUNNY, is located in the Roppongi district in Tokyo, and it's a place where you can touch, pet and take photos with cute fluffy rabbits! It has become one of the most popular animal cafes in Tokyo and a must for animal lovers! Rabbits at Ms.BUNNY are diverse in color and size. At this cafe, you can befriend irresistibly cute rabbits to your heart's content. The baby rabbits are so cute that it will be so hard for you to say goodbye to them in the end! The kinds of rabbits you can find at Ms.BUNNY are - Mini Rex - Holland Lop - Lion Lop - Netherland Dwarf Rabbit - Dwarf Hotot - French Lop Don't forget to bring your camera and take photos with them to show off to family and friends! We are very sure that you will miss these cute little friends so much when you get home. There are no drink and food menu at the rabbit cafe but there is a self-service drink bar so feel free to help yourself. Also you can bring your own food and drink (soft drinks only), so why don't you visit and chill with the little adorable rabbits? Since the rabbit cafe continues to become very popular, reservation is mandatory, especially during the weekends, so go ahead and reserve your time slot through our reservation system. It will leave an incredible memory of your time in Japan. Reservation slot: 12:00 pm-1:00 pm 1:00 pm-2:00 pm 2:00 pm-3:00 pm 3:00 pm-4:00 pm 4:00 pm-5:00 pm 5:00 pm-6:00 pm 6:00 pm-7:00 pm 7:00 pm-8:00 pm * Children under 12 must be accompanied by parents or guardian at all times.
strTitle: Play with cute fluffy rabbits at a cafe in Roppongi, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: There is lots of fantastic entertainment here in Akihabara for a new experience. This tour includes the following activities: Robot shop: It offers many kinds of robots like typical walking, cardboard box, educational, and some one-of-a-kind ones. You will be able to see some of the most advanced robot technologies here. Maid cafe: I'd like to take you to my favorite one or the most popular one. We will enjoy an afternoon tea at this special Japanese cafe. The maid cafe has been running for over 10 years. The maids are super friendly and cute. I am sure you will enjoy your stay there. Anime shops: What else do you associate with Japanese entertainment? Japan is known for its anime and manga culture, of course. The shops I'll take you to offers a variety of anime goods from latest to old ones! One of the tallest buildings that carry anime goods has seven stories! You will definitely find what you have been looking for here. Video game stores: Our last stop will be a good quality video game store which carries an incredible amount of games; it has the biggest selection in Akihabara. It has not only video games but also a lot of hobby goods, music, videos and software related to anime and idol groups. On top of that, the building houses an event space, where the idols have concerts on a regular basis! These stores are covering all the main attractions in Akihabara, and let you get a taste of Japanese entertainment. I'm looking forward to seeing you! I am available the whole day on weekends and after 17:30 on weekdays
strTitle: Explore Akihabara to the Fullest

strIntroduction: Niseko ski resort is one of the best places for winter activities in Japan. In recent years the popularity of this resort has increased especially among visitors from Australia. Niseko is a great place to enjoy skiing, snowboarding and backcountry, but the unique powder snow is perfect also for other types of activities such as snowshoe tours, snow mobile tours and many other interesting snow experiences. Nestled between Mt Niseko Annupuri and Mt Yotei, this place offers great opportunities for nature trekking and observing the wildlife. Snowshoe tours are an exciting way to spend a few hours in the wild nature with your family. This activity is suitable for first-timers so you don't need to worry about special preparation. Professional guides will lead you through the wild nature and will even treat you with some hot tea and cookies midway during the tour! In the nature-walk tour you will walk through the deep forests of either Mt Niseko Annupuri or Mt Yotei with a professional nature guide. You will observe the wild birds and will look for traces of wild animals in the snow. Nature-walk tour: Available from December to May Morning tour: 10:00 - 12:00 Afternoon tour: 13:30 - 15:30 Children over 6-year-old can participate. Please bring warm and water-proof clothes. Limited amount of rental clothing is available too.
strTitle: Try snowshoe experiences in Niseko, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: This is a cycling tour around Tokyo! Here is how the tour goes: 1. Meeting location: Coffee shop below my house 7 min walk from Nakameguro Station (Hibiya Line) *nakameguro is 5 min train from Shibuya 10:30 AM Meet up 10:35 Start the tour 10:45 Visit Kyu-Asakura House (Old style Japanese house belonging to a noble family) 11:15 Ride through Shibuya crossing (Ride through Shibuya) 11:25 Ride through Harajuku 11:40 Visit Meiji Shrine 12:10 Ride through backroads of Harajuku ("Ura-Hara") 12:30 Ride through Omotesando 12:45 Ride through Gaien-mae 13:00 Arrive back at the house
strTitle: Ride around Tokyo central area with a bilingual tour guide

strIntroduction: Sushi, Tempura, and Sukiyaki are not the only Japanese foods! You can try more and more and more great tasty Japanese foods! Do you like to eat and learn how to prepare it? Let's do it together at a really convenient area in Tokyo with your teacher Lisa who is a big food lover, and cooking lover! :D We are going to experience Japanese home cooking together, and you can ask me if you have any question, so that you can learn more! :D We are going to make one main dish, and 2 side dishes. The menu will be set by the chef, so please ask for the details. If you want to take a private lesson, I can arrange it for you too, so please let me know. Example of the menu: ☆Gyudon (Beef bowl), ☆Gyoza dumpling ☆Butano Kakuni (Braised pork belly) ☆Grilled pork with ginger sauce ☆Teriyaki Chicken ☆Sweet chicken wing with sweet sauce ☆Temaki Sushi (Roll Sushi) ☆Temari Sushi (One bite size Sushi) and more! Let's meet up at Roppongi Station (Toei Oedo line), and I will take you to my kitchen! It is only 1 minute walk from the station. If you are interested in a local supermarket tour, please let me know. I can arrange it for you too! :D (Depends on the schedule)
strTitle: Authentic Japanese Home Cooking Class in Roppongi, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is the private tour for you, not group tour. In the sacred land of Nikko 103 buildings of two Shinto shrines and a Buddhist temple are registered in the UNESCO World Heritage list. Among them 9 are the National Treasuries and 94 are the Important Cultural properties in Japan. You will discover great flamboyant architectural beauties! Just at Toshogu Shrine you can admire 5,173 carvings of flowers, the famous sleeping cat, the three wise monkeys and more. Walking along the ancient lanterns and the cedar trees can lead you to the ancient world as well. This sacred mountain's history dates back to the 8th century. Almost all buildings of Toshogu Shrie were rebuilt in 1634 by the third Shogun, Iemitsu. Rinnoji Temple is his mausoleum. The buildings impressed with the expression of wealth and might of the Tokugawa clan. It used to be said, “Don’t say you have seen the best until you visit Nikko”. The basic route is as follows, though the route can be changed upon your request: Meet at Asakusa Station and ride the express train. It takes about two hours. When we arrive at Nikko, let’s have a lunch at a restaurant. Then take the local bus and see the red wooden bridge through the window. Visit the Toshogu Shrine first and enjoy watching the giant pagoda, the Sacred Stable, the Yomeimon Gate and enter the Haiden hall that only the upper class of lords during the Edo period were allowed to access. Go to the shrine and grave of the shogun Ieyasu. Listen to the voice of the “Crying Dragon” at another building! Next go to Futarasan Shrine built in the 8th century through under the cedars trees. Take a short break at a small coffee or a tea house next to the natural fountain. There are many interesting things to see such as the old lantern cut by Japanese swords, a long sword, a spot to check your luck of the day etc. Go back to the station and back to Asakusa in Tokyo by train. If we have time, and you have more energy, we can also visit Rinnoji Temple. The shrines are located close but one complex itself consists of too many buildings and places to see. If you have interest in Japanese art, let’s go to museums and you can see splendid artworks such as painting on Japanese slide doors by the famous painter Yokoyama Taikan or beautiful swords. In this case, you have to give up on visiting another shrine, Futarasan.
strTitle: Take a one day trip to Nikko's World Heritage Shrines

strIntroduction: On this tour you will explore: First stop will be Shibuya scramble crossing. See this notorious Tokyo area that was featured in the "Lost In Translation" starring Bill Murray and Scarlet Johanson. See the fashion and art trendsetting shops, walking three main street including Takeshita st., Harajuku st. and Cat street between Harajuku and Shibuya. And finally we'll reach a famous Shibuya crossing steet. Also I could arrange some shops according to your preference. For the ultimate "Kawai" destination, we will drop into the Cat Café or Maid Café. "Kawaii" is the Japanese word for cute, and you haven't experienced cute quite like this café. Play with some of the most adorable kittens and enjoy a beverage of choice. The tour will conclude with sushi! Not just any type of sushi but one of the most high tech chains. The entire process of ordering and delivering will be done automatically! No better way to end an amazing day than with this famous sushi chain!
strTitle: Harajuku - Shibuya Private Walking Tour

strIntroduction: After a long flight into Osaka Itami Airport, the last thing you want to do is figure out the complicated train system or get onto a crowded bus. Instead, hire a transfer service directly to your hotel in Osaka in a comfortable coach or van and just relax as an expert driver makes its way into the city. There is no extra charge for early morning or late night flights! Likewise, when you need to head back to airport, instead of worrying about finding the right transportation to make it on time to your flight, just meet your driver at your hotel, and relax as they drive you back to the airport in time for your flight. There will be no need to run or stress about anything. This is definitely the fastest and most convenient way to move between Osaka's Itami airport and the city center, so book your transfer now.
strTitle: Osaka Itami Airport shared shuttle transfer to/from Osaka

strIntroduction: Explore the best Kyoto has to offer with this historical full day tour of Japan's ancient capital departing from Umeda or Namba in Osaka. This tour will take you by bus to Kyoto, where you will first make a stop at one of Japan's most iconic Shino shrines, the Fushimi Inari Shrine, famous for its countless bright-colored torii gates lining the pathway up a mountain. You'll have plenty of time to explore and take amazing pictures. The tour will then move on to Arashiyama area in western Kyoto using local trains. You'll be able to visit the world-famous bamboo forest and admire the traditional architecture of the area. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a traditional Japanese lunch. Lastly, the tour move on to Kinkakuji or the Golden Pavillion, with it's gold-plated roof, it has become the landmark of Kyoto and the quintessential must-see attraction of the city. After a full day of sightseeing, you will return to Osaka by bus. Itinerary: 8:40 - Umeda Pickup: Hearton Hotel Nishiumeda 9:00 - Namba Pickup: Namba OCAT 10:00 - Arrival to Kyoto 10:00 - Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine 11:30 - Arashiyama 13:50 - Randen Train from Arashiyama Station to Shijo Omiya Station 14:11 - Bus Ride from Shijo Omiya Station to Kinkakuji Temple 14:40 - Kinkakuji Temple 15:55 - Drop off at Kyoto station 16:55 - Drop off at Namba OCAT 17:10 - Drop off at Hearton Hotel Nishiumeda ***This is not a guided tour, however a tour operator that can speak English will be on board.
strTitle: Enjoy a full day bus and train tour of Kyoto from Osaka

strIntroduction: The shinkansen rail network in Japan is famous around the world for its punctuality, comfort, efficiency, safety and speed. With top speeds around 320 km/h, Japan Rail's bullet train, or shinkansen, is an experience in its own right, as well as a great way to travel. This program is a reservation for shinkansen bullet train ticket in between Osaka/Hiroshima with a half day or one day private tour guide that will meet you in Hiroshima. The tour guide will arrange the trip schedule, so you can request the guide to include the places that you would like to visit. Some famous sightseeing spots for Hiroshima are as follows: - Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park Created to symbolize the need for everlasting peace, Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park (Hiroshima Heiwa Kinen Kōen) commemorates the many victims of the world's first nuclear attack in August 1945. - Ikutsushima Shrine Miyajima, the Shrine Island, is one of Japan's most important (and most visited) coastal sites. Covering some 30 square kilometers of Hiroshima Bay, the island is famous for Itsukushima shrine, dedicated to the Princesses Ichikishimahime, Tagorihime and Tagitsu-hime, daughters of the Shinto wind god Susanoo. - Hiroshima Castle Also known as the Castle of Carp, Hiroshima Castle (Rijō) was built in 1593 as the residence of local nobleman Fukushima Masanori before passing into the possession of famous samurai Asano Nagaakira in 1619. ※In case you need to start the tour from Osaka, traveling time will be included in the tour. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We need at least 3 business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if we don't get your hotel information soon enough, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office. Please reference the pickup information under Ticket Pickup below. - If you are not staying at a hotel, we recommend collecting the tickets from our office. 2. Ticket Pickup: You can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 7 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-shibuya Google Map: http://voyag.in/hachiko-to-voyagin
strTitle: Day trip to Hiroshima from Osaka by Shinkansen (guided tour)

strIntroduction: Recently, Japanese animation is becoming more popular in foreign countries. It's an interesting way to learn the Japanese language and the culture through animation. Four-M, a photo studio in Osaka, offers a great opportunity to explore Japanese culture through a photo shoot with a costume. It takes approximately 1 minute to walk to the studio from Nipponbashi station of Sennichimae Line and Sakaisuji Line. On a reservation, select the plan that suits your schedule. They have 3 plans with optional items, allowing you to arrange a special photo shoot just for you. Once you get to the photo studio, select your costume and photo booth. Dress up in your favorite and get your make up done, then say cheese! A professional photographer will take your best shot! After choosing a photo to be developed, the process is complete. Just take your photo and photo data with you as a wonderful memory! You'll keep it along with your photo. Here are the details of 3 plans. 1. Plan Bamboo (Basic Plan) It takes about 35 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・One choice of costume ・Two choices of photo booth ・All the photo data for your SNS ・One picture 2. Plan Pine (Multiple Costumes Plan) It takes about 60-90 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・All the costumes you can use ・All the photo booths you can use ・All the photo data for your SNS ・Two pictures 3. Family Plan/1 group (4-5 people) It takes about 60-120 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・All the costumes you can use ・All the photo booths you can use ・All the photo data for your SNS ・Two pictures per person ・One original calendar The calendar needs 2 hours to be printed out, so you may possibly need to arrange another date for pick-up. Four-M has an option to kindly mail it to your home. Please confirm about it. Four-M is opened daily from 10 AM to 8 PM. All the photo shooting plans need a reservation.
strTitle: Dress Up as Your Favorite Character For Photography in Osaka

strIntroduction: Experience calligraphy, a type of Japanese traditional culture, but in a different and untraditional way. This is contemporary shodo where the style is different, and the modern design has been used for various products and services. You will experience writing your favorite words by learning basic writing technique on a special paper. The teacher will teach you how to write your name in Japanese characters. The teacher will teach you the meaning of "kanji" as well. Of course, you can take the paper back home with you. The teacher is a famous creater/designer and has participated in many projects for making logos for game, manga, product, brand images, company logos, and more! Upon your request, the teacher can prepare your writing in digital data, so that you can print it on your favorite item, such as a mug, a T-shirt, etc. *The digital data costs additional 1000 JPY, please pay in cash on the day. As a souvenir, you will receive a brush and magic paper for you to experience at home! Only the participants will get to know what the magic paper is!
strTitle: Experience contemporary calligraphy with a real designer

strIntroduction: Similar to what sommeliers do, “Kikizake” (sake tasting) is an activity that involves guessing what brand of sake you are served blindfolded. In this activity, you will... • You will chose 5 kinds of sake from 20~30 sake and enjoy the different tastes of each sake. If you like the sake you tasted, you can order it directly from its place of origin as well. Let us know if you have a particular preference for what type of sake you’d like to drink in advance so we can choose the sakes according to your taste. Sake varies in dryness (alcohol percentage) and can be served cold or warm. (Price includes the cost for 5 brands of Sake)
strTitle: Sake Tasting

strIntroduction: In this exciting activity you will learn a few basic "kata" techniques. Kata are small, structured practice routines or protocols. Samurai as well as ninja folks do Kata workouts everyday. Kata are typically for learning the fundamentals to build on later. Studied and practiced properly, kata provides a method for creating and expressing various feelings and moods. A workout with an instructor provides you with the habits of thinking quickly on your feet and acting rapidly especially when self-defence is needed. Another aspect of kata practice is the analysis of the movements during the workout to determine the more advanced techniques. Through physical practice mastering the patterns become your second nature. This private session will give you a good insight into the samurai way of thinking.
strTitle: Try a 90-minute Swordfight "Kata" Workout - Beginners Level

strIntroduction: Pick up at Matsumoto Castle at 1:30 pm and eat Japanese seasonal foods at a classic house with a Zashiki room on a 2-hour experience. You can enjoy these experiences depending on the season. Autumn ~20.Nov Picking up apples and eating autumn foods in a Zashiki room. We're running an apple orchard in Matsumoto, Nagano. You can eat various kinds of apples. Winter 30.Nov ~28.Feb Trying mochi (Japanese rice cake) pounding and eating it. We do mochi pounding and eat mochi on New Year's day in Japan. You can enjoy Japanese traditional winter life. Spring Going to Yomogi (mugwort) picking and making green mochi. There are a lot of nature views around our house. Summer Experience Nagashi-Somen (flowing Japanese noodle) and eat it. Nagashi-somen is a traditional summer activity in Japan. It includes serving noodles not in a bowl or a plate, but racing by in a bamboo pipe full of flowing water. You catch the noodles with your chopsticks, dip them in a cup of flavorful sauce and eat. We'll drive you to Matsumoto Castle or anywhere in Matsumoto city if you want.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese seasonal foods and culture at Yokoya farm

strIntroduction: Come and visit an ordinary traditional Japanese home where you can experience Japanese cooking at the dinner table with your family and friends. In this experience, we will make and eat Japanese pizza, Okonomiyaki together! Okonomiyaki is popular Japanese food. There are so many toppings and ingredients. Okonomiyaki is sometimes translated as "As-you-like-it Pizza" because of its wide variety. Main ingredients are flour, water, vegetables, meats and sea-foods. While waiting for your meal to be ready, you will learn how this particular dish (okonomiyaki) originated over the history of Japan, and I will chat with you while we sip some lovely Japanese tea. Let's enjoy okonomiyaki at the dinner table!
strTitle: Visit a Japanese Home and Make Japanese Pizza!

strIntroduction: Make a professional handmade Japanese stone seal by yourself! You’ll get your very own, unique seal. You will be guided in your work by a Japanese stone seal professor. Japanese seals can be made from wood, bamboo, stone, hone, meal or plastics etc. At this event, you’ll make your one and only personal stone seal with stone, which is easy to be sculpted. You will be able to carve what you wish with a stylus, and the craftsman will assist you in carving your nickname in Japanese hiragana or katakana. (It is also possible to carve in kanji, Chinese character, but you need a bigger stone seal for an extra fee) The stone seal acts as a signature in Japan. With the seal you will create during this workshop, you will be able to stamp your business cards, letters, or even works of art! We prepare special small gifts for the guest from FindJPN. Please come and enjoy our event!
strTitle: Craft your own Japanese Stone Seal

strIntroduction: Making Japanese pottery is an excellent way to experience Japanese culture. Pottery in Japan is the oldest form of art in the country. Yet due to its long history, many people believe making pottery requires special and sophisticated skills. But it’s not true! Anyone can make pottery! Even if you think your not good with your hands, the artisans who speak English will help you! Within the one hour, you can create as many creations as you can. The number of works is unlimited! Going through the process of trimming, glazing, and firing twice, your work will be done 3 weeks after your experience date. Please choose if you would like to pick up your work to our studio, or have them sent overseas. Price does not include calcination fee and shipping fee. Calcination fee depends on your work's size. We calculate by high X wide X diameter X 1.5, and price is about 1500 JPY for a rice bowl. Shipping is possible overseas. We use the Japanese international EMS posting service. For these additional payments required on the day, we accept Japanese Yen and the credit cards below: Visa, Master card, American Express, JCB, Discover When you make a booking, please choose if you prefer "wheel throwing" or "hand-building." Children over 3 are very welcome too! We believe that kids should not be limited in finding their potential.When they are open to new ideas and experiences, they can create ANYTHING in their lives! Kids will receive the basic information about material, firing and pottery making process. The class is for one hour and the cost is as the same as adults. Our studio is located just 5 minutes away from Tokyo Tower; come stop by on your visit to this area!
strTitle: Join a Japanese Pottery Class

strIntroduction: Come to my house and learn how to make Wagashi (traditional Japanese sweets & confectionery) in Shibuya, Tokyo! Wagashi is typical Japanese sweet comprising sweet red been paste, rice cake, and some special ingredients. My goal is to introduce this skill to travellers visiting Japan so everyone can enjoy making Wagashi and matching it with Japanese green tea. We make Japanese traditional sweets - regular or seasonal. Both come with green tea. === Regular menu=== Nerikiri - The most famous Wagashi, a unique shape made of sweet white bean paste === Seasonal menu === Mochi sweets Feel free to come and relax and have fun learning to make Wagashi together! I look forward to seeing you soon! Photo by: https://flic.kr/p/9ApyLY
strTitle: Make Wagashi! Traditional Japanese Sweets in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Experience a private authentic tea ceremony after you have visited the famous Golden Pavilion (Kinkakuji) in Kyoto! In only 45 minutes you will attend the following: 1. Introduction to the roots of tea ceremony in Japan: The spirit of Chado, utensils, and history. 2. Watch a traditional ceremony performed by a lecturer of Urasenke, which is one of the most famous tea schools in Japan. I provide seasonal tea utensils that will help you enjoy the Japanese four seasons. 3. Have traditional Japanese sweets and learn how to make your own powdered green tea. Use traditional utensils to make powdered green tea by yourself. Special sweets often served in Real tea ceremonies in Kyoto will be prepared for Voyagin guests! In addition, you can take free photos in the vestibule, decorated with kimono and traditional Nishijin textile and Japanese paintings. Please choose from the following available times for this activity: - 11:45～12:30 - 13:00～13:45 - 14:15～15:00 - 15:30～16:15 - 16:45～17:30 This activity is available everyday. Option: Kimono Wearing & Tea Ceremony Please choose from the following available times for this activity: Age: Required over 9 years old -You can wear Kimono and join tea ceremony. It includes introduction, 2 bowls of powdered green tea and sweets, and the experience to make powdered green tea by yourselves. You can take photos in a tea room as well as the waiting room with Japanese seasonal displays. Option: Special tea ceremony at night! Available from 18:00 to 20:00 pm. Includes Japanese light meal, fresh sweets, Japanese cookies, thick & thin tea. Option: Ikebana class in the morning! Available from 10:00-11:00am. Price includes flowers or trees.
strTitle: Enjoy a Tea Ceremony with Special Sweets in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Hokkaido is one of the best places to try horseback riding, as it is abundant in natural beauty, with rolling fields, dramatic mountains, gurgling streams and colorful blossoms that vary with the seasons. Just 40 mins by car from Sapporo City, you can immerse yourself in the wild outback of Hokkaido and enjoy the bucolic surroundings on horseback. Choose from a 40min to 60 min horse riding course, and be enchanted by the gentle nature of these gentle beasts and soothing rhythm of a horse ride. After the journey, have fun feeding the horses with their favorite snack, carrot sticks, and have your photos taken with your favorite steed. This is a fun activity for the whole family, and children from 7 years and above can ride their own horse! Don't worry, the horses know the way so they won't get lost.
strTitle: Horseback Riding in Sapporo with Taxi Pick-Up Service

strIntroduction: Furano Cheese Factory is one of the most popular places for production of cheese in Furano, Hokkaido. The northern Japanese island is widely known for its rich quantities of milk and industrial production of butter and cheese. In fact, Hokkaido's cheese is considered to be one of the finest and will satisfy even the most demanding tastes. At the Furano Cheese Factory you can see the process of making the local camembert cheese behind large windows. Furthermore the place boasts the production of ice-creams with unique tastes including sweet corn and black squid ink. There is also a pizza bar where you can try locally made pizza cooked in an old-fashioned furnace. The highlight of Furano Cheese Factory however are the hands-on experiences offered in the workshop. You can learn how to make your own butter, ice-cream, cheese and bread! Due to the popularity of the place and the limited availability of the classes, prior reservation is necessary in order to take part in the hands-on activities. We will make a reservation for you and will secure your place in the classes offered. You will be able to pay the small class fee when you arrive. The local staff will be expecting you and in some cases (such as the bread making workshop) they will have completed the necessary preparations of the dough. The following schedule shows the times of the classes: - Butter making: 9:15, 10:15, 11:15, 13:15, 14:15, 15:15 You will make 60 gram of butter. The class takes about 40 minutes. - Ice-cream making: 9:15, 10:15, 11:15, 13:15, 14:15, 15:15 You will make 100 gram of butter. The class takes about 40 minutes. NOTE: Please note that at least 4 people are necessary for this class to be held! If there are 3 or less participants, minimum participation fee (2,152JPY) will be payable on the activity date. If the number of participants is over 4, the participation fee will be 700JPY per person. - Cheese making: 9:30, 11:00, 13:30, 15:00 You will make 100 gram of cheese. The class takes about 60 minutes. - Bread making: 10:00, 13:30 You will make about 6 pieces of bread. The class takes about 90 minutes. NOTE: *Please note that at least 2 people are necessary for this class to be held! *Please note that the reservation for bread making has to be made before three days in advance. Note that in the winter months (November-March) the 15:15 classes are not held. Don't miss your chance to participate in Hokkaido's best known hands-on workshops and don't rely on availability without a prior reservation! We will help you arrange these unique activities during your trip to Hokkaido!
strTitle: Make cheese, butter and ice-cream at Furano Cheese Factory!

strIntroduction: This hassle-free tour is designed to give you a chance to visit and see the region's top attractions and winter landscape. At the same time you will be able to enjoy winter activities and taste the local delicacies of Hokkaido as well. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 A pick-up service will be arranged. From New Chitose Airport, you will be transported to your hotel at Sapporo. After check-in (from 3pm), you will be given free-time to relax or explore the area. Day 2 A day tour with private transportation around Sapporo city will be provided. This tour will include the following attractions: Hokkaido University Campus, Former Hokkaido Government Office Building, Odori Park, Nijo Market, Moerenuma Park, Hokkaido Shrine, Okurayama Observatory, Sapporo Beer Museum. End the day with a full-course Genghis Khan dinner. Day 3 A day tour with private transportation around Otaru city will be provided. This tour will include the following attractions: Shukutsu Panorama Observatory, Music Box Museum, Bank of Japan Museum, Kitaichi Glass Gallery, Otaru Canal Area. End the day with a sumptuous Hokkaido crab dinner. Day 4 A day tour with private transportation around Lake Shikotsu, Toya, and Noboribetsu will be provided. This tour will include the following attractions: Lake Shikotsu scenic area, Noboribetsu Hell Valley, Showa Shinzan Lava Dome; Lake Toya. Return to Hotel. Day 5 Free time and airport transfer to New Chitose Airport. What this tour includes: - Hotel accommodation for four nights with breakfast inclusions - Round-trip airport transfers - Day tours with private transportation - Full-course dinner at Genghis Khan Restaurant - Full-course crab dinner * Entrance fees to attractions are not included * Optional Add-in: English-speaking local guide * Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour * Itinerary may change subject to local conditions. *This tour package is only available from December 2 to March 31 and cannot be availed during the following blackout dates: February 5 to February 14
strTitle: 5-day Package Tour from Sapporo in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Transferring from Itami Airport to Osaka City with luggages will give you much burden and will be very complicated, so we suggest you to make a reservation for this Itami Airport private taxi transfer service. This transfer services provides you an elegant private ride in between Itami Airport and Osaka City area, covering most parts of Osaka City. You can travel to or from Itami Airport with no hassles and will have a luxurious and comfortable ride to your destinations. All plans include: - English speaking driver - Expressway tolls - Parking fee - Transfer fee in between Itami Airport and Osaka City There are three sizes of taxi available for this service: - Small 3 people & 2 luggages - Medium 4 people & 3 luggages, or 5 people & 2 luggages - Large 9 people & 9 luggages Please note that the price will increase 25% if you book this service in between 23:00 - 5:00. In addition, you will be charged for extra-fee if you will be visiting any areas other than Osaka City. Pick-up and drop-off services are available in between Itami Airport & Osaka City. In addition, please also inform us the precise building name and address of the pick-up / drop-off location, and an English-speaking staff with name board will meet you at the designated location. Enjoy a stress free and burden less travel with a private sedan taxi!
strTitle: Enjoy Private Taxi Transfer Between Itami Airport&Osaka City

strIntroduction: Shinjuku Golden-gai Tour - Night Life in Tokyo Golden-gai is an area located in east Shinjuku famous for its many bars – a number that exceeds 300. Outside of a few outliers, most of these bars are incredibly tiny and can seat only four or five customers at one time. Each bar offers its own unique atmosphere and most even feature an odd theme. There are a number of music bars, otaku bars, a video game bar, a nurse bar, karaoke bars, and most anything else you can imagine. Just looking for a relaxing watering hole or a place with a classic Japanese vibe? Don’t worry, there are dozens of those in Golden-gai, as well. Booming as a black market back in the 1950s after the Second World War, the street has since then continually developed its culture of drinking. To this day, Golden-gai is a popular drinking spot for both young and old. However, even Japanese people have difficulty going for a drink in Golden-gai without any introduction. In this activity, we'll visit a few bars in Golden-gai in order to get a little flavor of what the neighborhood has to offer. Important! If you wish to start the tour at 21:00 pm or later, you need to book the add-on option as well. Extra fee applies for tours which start at 21:00 pm or later. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/dF9UZT http://flic.kr/p/9vo3JA http://flic.kr/p/dF9VHg http://flic.kr/p/2CLx7Z http://flic.kr/p/gJwQHU http://flic.kr/p/ajNxQi
strTitle: Enjoy Shinjuku Kabuki-cho, Golden-gai Night Tour

strIntroduction: A fantastic chance to discover some rural charm just a short train ride away from the metropolis of Kyoto City. Discover the wonderful nature and ancient religious sites in Kurama and Kibune. We meet in the city and take a train ride to Kibune village, a place well-known for its beautiful riverside and peaceful scenery. There is also an exquisite shrine called the "Kibune Shrine", where you can see an amazing view of red lanterns along an old stairway. Here we can drink fresh water flowing from the hills and say a prayer for good relationships. After a quick visit at the shrine we are on to the hiking course. It's a bit of a "stairmaster" to the top and requires a moderate level of fitness but the peak can be reached within 30-40mins. We will certainly take plenty of stops to enjoy the breathtaking nature along the way, as well as some features unique to this trail. After we reach the top of the mountain, we will be visiting Kurama Temple. This splendid temple will provide you with an amazing view of the valley below. Lets relax and enjoy the fresh air in the mountains. As we wander down the steps from the temple, we will make our way to the little town of Kurama to enjoy a nice lunch followed by a trip to an outdoor bath! The bath, also called an 'onsen' is full with rich minerals that will energise your body and soul. You will also witness the tranquil view of the countryside, surrounded by hills. In my opinion, this 'onsen' provides the best outdoor bathing experience in West Japan. After a nice, relaxing bath, it's time to hop on the train to get back to the city feeling refreshed and energised. Come take a breathtaking riverside stroll, a visit to one of Japan's most photographed shrines, a hike through nature, and a hot spring experience you will never forget! I look forward to exploring this gem in hills of Kyoto with you!
strTitle: Hike to Kurama Temple & Enjoy a Hot Spring Bath!

strIntroduction: In Japan we have 4 seasons and in each season we can find different fish and vegetables, which makes our food culture varied. So first, let's explore a market in Temma, which is just 1 station from JR Osaka, and I'll explain seasonal Japanese ingredients and we'll buy what we need for our cooking. Then we'll go back home and cook some Japanese food. Examples of the menus of Japanese dishes: You will cook 1 main dish, 1 side dish, Miso soup, and Japanese rice. The example of the main menus are as following, Sushi Roll Okonomiyaki Yakisoba Tempura Sashimi Karaage Teriyaki Ginger-flavored steak. Niku-jaga. Oyako-don Tonkatsu (Katsu) or katsudon Sukiyaki Duke-don Saba no Misoni Gyudon Takikomi Gohan and so on... or you can choose one ingredient for the main dish, for example, beef, pork, chicken, fish or tofu... then I can arrange the menu for you :) Language: English. I have lived in Australia. And I also work as an English teacher. Schedule: Please contact me for details. The class starts at 10 am. Meeting place: JR Temma station 1 station from JR Osaka or Subway Ogimachi station Exit 1 (Sakaisuji "brown" line)
strTitle: Enjoy a market tour and Japanese home cooking in Osaka!

strIntroduction: In this experience we focus on bringing to light the traditional beauty of Japan. Choose from a selection of various Edo period traditional kimonos and costumes. I hope you will enjoy this once in a lifetime experience in the beautiful and ancient old capital Kyoto. ************************************************** Inclusions: ・Historical costumes ・Your choice of kimono from selection of Historical costumes available. (For example: -Edo period young lady Kimono costume. -Edo period young man Kimono costume. -Edo period samurai costume. -Ninja costume -Modern Kimono costume. ・Dressing (Fitting) Professional staff help you dress in a historical period costume（hair dressing not included). ・All costumes are eligible for the photo service at our in-store studio. You will receive the photos in CD-ROM. ************************************************** Schedule: 1. Meet up in a station in Kyoto city. 2. Counseling: Before the photoshoot I will council details with you, such as what image or style you wish for your photographs, costumes etc. 3. Fitting: Choose an outfit for the photoshoot. 4. Photography: In the case of only one costume, the time will be 30 min - 1 hour of shooting and the total time approximately 2 hours, including dressing time and choosing your photograph. 5. Photograph selection: Finally, choose your favorite photo on a big screen monitor. 6. Delivery of your photograghs: You can purchase options plans such as: B）Walk around nearby in your costume C）Photo Shoot + Walk around street for a while. Professional staff help you dress in a historical period costume ************************************************** After the changing costumes, I will take you to a nice Shrine, or somewhere. I can advise you about your further sightseeing.
strTitle: Dress as a samurai and take photos in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Tsukiji is one of the 11 markets in Tokyo. It is the largest fish and seafood market in the world and also one of the largest food markets of any kind. Tsukiji handles more than 2000 tons of 480 types of seafood and 1100 tons of fruit and vegetables daily. The Tsukiji Market, which is 23 hectares wide, is separated into two main areas: the Inner Market and the Outer Market. The Inner Market is the wholesale market for the professionals, and that is where the fish auction takes place. The Outer Market retails some of the fresh seafood and vegetables sold in the Inner Market. Primarily, both markets cater to the professionals, but the Outer Market has recently opened its doors to visitors. Nevertheless visitors are allowed to enter the Inner Market as well after 9:00 am under the condition that they go in a small guided group of 4 or less. The Inner Market is usually more interesting because visitors can see the actual wholesale of the seafood. In this tour you will visit the Tsukiji Fish Market with a professional guide and will have the chance to see the exciting wholesale of the seafood. After the tour you can have fresh sushi with seafood coming directly from the market. Tsukiji Fish Market is closed every Sunday and on the following days: Closed Dates in 2016: November 3, 9, 16, 23 December 7，23，31 Closed Dates in 2017: January 2，3, 4，9, 18，25 February 1, 11，15，22 March 8，15，20，29 April 5，12，19，29 May 3，4，5，10，24 June 7，14，21，28 July 5, 17，26 August 11，14, 15，23，30 September 13，18，23，27 October 4，9，18，25 November 3，8，15，23 December 6
strTitle: See the world's largest Tsukiji Fish Market in private tour

strIntroduction: Follow your own personal maid guide on a private tour as she takes you deep into the heart of Akihabara, to discover the places tourists don't usually get to go... She will take you to the centre of the anime and manga culture which began in Akihabara. You'll also have a unique experience at a real Japanese maid cafe! On this two and a half hour walking tour, your guide will provide an unforgettable experience of all things Akihabara that you won’t be able to find in the guidebooks. We have guides fluent in English, Japanese and Mandarin - ask them anything about Akihabara, Tokyo, or Japan in general. Due to the popularity of the tour, you may be interviewed by the Japanese media, but if you are uncomfortable with this idea please let us know, and we'll make sure that you're left in peace. Please let us know the following info when you make the booking. - Names of each participant - Ages - Genders - Nationality - Contact phone number - Hotel name - Duration of stay in Japan Thanks! We run our tours every day, from 11 am, 3 pm, or 6 pm If possible, when you request a tour please provide two alternative requested tour dates and times in your message to help us ensure we can fit you in. We're looking forward to seeing you in Akihabara!
strTitle: Akihabara Tour with Your Own Personal Maid!

strIntroduction: In this trial class, you will learn about the warrior's spirit behind karate, and you will be able to practice some of karate's basic skills. Practice classes are held in Tokyo in Itabashi (Kami-Itabashi Station) and Zoshigaya (Zoshigaya or Mejiro Station). Private classes are also held in Yokohama (Yamate, Sakuragicho, or Yokohama Station). Please choose the most convenient location for you. We can pick you up from a desired station in Tokyo and Yokohama area. After the pick up, we will go to the practice studio and directly start the practice. In case you need our help before and after the karate class (for example, preparing karate clothes and equipment), we will be happy to help. Regular practice starts from 6:00pm and ends by 9:00pm on weekdays. Different schedules apply for holidays and weekends, please ask in advance. Before or after the class, we can sit down for a bit and talk more about the art and tradition of karate.
strTitle: Practice karate in a trial course in Tokyo/Yokohama

strIntroduction: Do you want to eat, drink and be merry? The Japanese izakaya is perhaps the perfect combination of a bar and restaurant, and Tokyo has plenty of funny themed izakayas' that love to add entertainment! However, there is one that really stands out, a little-known place in Shinbashi that combines good Japanese food, drinks from around the world, and a "Master" of the izakaya who will treat you to a surreal performance and many tricks! Why we love it: - You will be shocked by the funny performances by the master of this crazy izakaya! - You won't stop laughing when the master begins his show! - You might meet the popular character Anpanman! - You will love the delicious Japanese style dinner! - You may find a trick glass on the table..? - There are some tricks even inside the bathroom! Don't miss it! - Since the master of this crazy restaurant speaks English, you can (and will!) communicate with him in English. - You might be a part of his show! ※ With adult content in parts of the show, this izakaya is not recommended for families with young children. * Additional 500 JPY as entrance fee per person will be required to pay at the izakaya on the reservation date. Earliest reservation time: 18:30 Latest reservation time: 23:00
strTitle: Laugh All Night at the Wackiest Izakaya in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: From high-class whiskey bars to pulsating disco clubs, Kyoto indeed has an amazing array of bars, pubs and "izakaya” (Japanese tapas bar) . As you visit Kyoto, you get a chance to explore a number of curious and exciting and uniquely Japanese nightlife venues, such as the mushroom bar and the bar where samurai's once drank featuring a half sized door (designed to make you disarm your sword before entering) or the dark bar light up only by candle light and playing chilled ambient beats. So, let's get together and explore all these memorable and fun places in Kyoto. The tour will include visits to at least one izakaya (for some pub snacks and drinks), a small bar (for a drink or two) and a fun place to let loose and dance or a classy bar to finish off the night depending on the mood. While the tour officially ends at midnight, it has been known to go a little later :) Do you want to learn some Japanese phrases and expressions before the tour? Sign up for the option for a Japanese lesson before we head out and get a chance to use what you learned during the tour. This is a fun and exciting chance to see Kyoto from a local resident's perspective. Kyoto has some of the best bars (and bartenders) on the planet so I am sure that when you take this tour I am sure that you will have a night to remember for many years to come. Every Thursday Night this tour includes 1hr of all you can drink and snacks from a limited at the first location and a lot more fun to come throughout the night. Inquire now to book your place!
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Bar Hopping Experience!
